column6: Very nice servers and amazing food!, wish I would have found this place sooner, and it's a great spot for ramen as well
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the VERY few places with a cute/modern atmosphere that feels clean in Chinatown. We love walking around in the neighborhood, but the eating establishments there are usually VERY sketch. We were REALLY surprised to find this place and it turned out to be awesome in every way. Great service, food, drinks and an excellent value during happy hour. The Ramen was delicious, as was the rice bowl, the pork boa buns, shrimp shumai, an squid skewers.  Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Definitely a new spot in the ramen rotation. Loved the tonkatsu ramen here, perfectly rich and full of pork flavor. Serving size was very generous. Pork gyoza were also 5/5 wonderful. Nice cute space that is well decorated and cozy.

Walked in here at 4:30 for happy hour and I was seated immediately!! I ordered myself a glass of plum wine and jalapeño chicken wings to start and they did not disappoint. The wings were crispy, flavorful and not too greasy. I wish there was a dipping sauce that came with the chicken but it's still one of my fave dishes! I also felt hungry after drinking my wine (which was decently strong and sweet) so I ordered Takoyaki! It was crispy, creamy with pops of umami and also chewy from the octopus. That was really fun to eat. I can't wait to come back here the next time I am in the area. There are so many more items on the menu I am excited to try.
No comment
No comment
The ramen broth was rich and filling, the service was quick we sat and place our order and got our ramen. I just wish they had more selection.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really great happy hour prices, sake, and ramen. The spicy selection adds great flavor but isn't totally unapproachable. Great appetizer selection as well!
The ramen is decent. The appetizers were eh. Nice place to try. Won't be back. Broths weren't too salty but when I got closer to the bottom a little too much.
No comment

This place was delicious! We got a little worried cause it was in a random alley, but the food is great! The oysters were amazing, def try the barnstable. The takoyaki was some of the best I've had. We also got the spicy tonkatsu ramen and the katsu rice bowl, both were great!
Solid happy hour spot- lots of fun and delicious items to choose from. We tried ramen, octopus balls, wings and oysters. Staff are friendly.  Looking forward to our next visit!
No comment
No comment

A quaint little ramen shop that also has an oyster bar. The place can seat around 25 and an outdoor section (wasn't open when I was there). I ordered the spicy tonkatsu and requested with the noodles a little undercooked. Noodles were cooked to my liking! The toppings were very sparse. Pork was cooked to tender goodness but something with the broth didn't impress me. Wonderful service, clean bathroom, nice decorations.
It was great! Staff was nice, ramen was delicious, and apps were rich! They took into account modifications well, and I definitely want to come back and try the salt broth
Great ramen - light broth, could use a bit more seasoning. Would recommend and would order from them again.

Came in for some ramen on a crazy craving however something made me pause and I ordered appetizers first. Not too many as not to get full but enough to give it a try and see what's what. That's where the trying ended. Ordered a negori (yum! Actually a delicious unfiltered heavenly sake) then got seaweed salad, chicken bun and shrimp shumai. The seaweed salad was soaked in a unpleasant overpowering dressing that's usually just a footnote with others so the sesame flavor could shine. Then came the shumai which was drenched in sauce and lacking in shrimp flavor. The bun. The bun, it was nicely moist however the chicken wasn't crispy and resembled more of a chicken nugget texture/flavor. Overall the place wasn't a let down as the appetizer were edible it just didn't make you want to eat more.
No comment
No comment

$1 happy hour oysters are what lured me to this place for a second time. We got a dozen and they tasted fresh and they were cleaned and shucked very well. I got the Miso Ramen and it was decent but the broth did start to taste a bit too salty towards the end. Overall this place always has great service and decent food for an affordable price!

Tasty, unique and high quality ramen. Glad I discovered this and would definitely come back here on a cold day. I had the spicy Tonkotsu ramen and it was perfect. My partner bravely ordered the Salt Ramen and it was so unique and amazing - highly recommend. The ramen was essentially inside a uniquely herbed but still perfectly light chicken broth (no more salty than the other ramens!). We didn't do an appetizer but a lot of guests where there for an oyster happy hour which we'd partake in next time.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: $1 oyster happy hour, $5 plum wine, great service, and delicious ramen? I can't get enough! I wish I lived closer. Overall, solid place and great spot for a small group of friends to get a night started.

I've never had a good experience getting ramen delivered at home so was skeptical this time, but was really craving it. I'm so so happy I went ahead and ordered from Zest because it did not disappoint! I got the Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen and it just hit the spot! Would definitely order again

It's a SOLID 4. I don't know what to criticize other than well yeah you can go deeper and spend more budget on manpower putting details to the broth or watevs but THIS place has everything you need for a night out. They got the appetizers, booze and the table. You can dine with friends or date, atmosphere is there. Beautiful interior ambiance, more into traditional Japanese feel. Price is on the medium to affordable. Service is standard, nothing to complain. Very nice people.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love ZEST! I must say that the food here is amazingggg! I love my pineapple fried rice and California rolls. I order all the time from here and they never fail me. They are super clean. Robin the server is such a sweetheart super attentive and very helpful in choosing what to eat. The ambience is very calm and quite. I will always come back and definitely recommend
No comment
Great food and service, best ramen I've ever had? No.. but it was at a solid level and the wait staff were super on top of making sure all went well.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Zest ramen is managed well and has good staff they are nice and tend to your needs , the ramen is good even tho most options are pork based (i don't eat pork) my ramen with chicken was good , and a good earthy meal , THE BEST THING I ATE ON THE MENU WAS THE THAI SPRING ROLLS  we had to order like 5 more orders it's a crispy on the outside and shrimp and crab deli on the inside ‍‍‍

I ordered the Miso, my wife ordered Tonkotsu and we both had two orders of the Pork Belly Baos. Everything was insanely good, the best in fact. My wife and I both woke up craving Ramen; which sucks because there is no good Ramen near us. The flavor of the broth was perfect for both soups. It actually gets a little spicier towards the end, but it's still very delicious. The portions are also perfect. The baos were so good that we ordered two each. The best part about the Baos is that the pork was not just a bunch of fat. It was actual crunchy pieces of pork. I highly recommend this place. If you can make reservations I would also recommend doing so. It's rather small so I can only imagine that it gets packed on a busy day. We will be back here the next time we go to NYC.

Whenever I'm in New York City, I figure out a way to get down here to eat ramen. It's my favorite ramen place in the city. Have I tried all of them? No. But I have been to several places that left me wishing I had spent that money on the Korean ramen I can buy and cook at home. But not Zest. Once I discovered this place, I am hesitant to try other places. The broth always tastes so good and not as salty as other places, and the noodles are always perfect. Their appetizers are also yummy but I don't usually get any because I'm so excited about the ramen and it fills me up!
Delicious! Ordered ramen for takeout and it was ready when I arrived. The restaurant looked super trendy and I would definitely go back.
No comment
This is an approved place to get ramen. The whole meal didn't disappoint except for the small sushi, but other than that . (I forgot to take a picture before I digged into my spicy miso).
No comment
No comment
No comment
Wanted to go to another place nearby but it was packed so we went here instead and I was not disappointed. Literally emptied the bowl it was so good.
Good flavor !! I got the ramen and added wavy noodles and my boyfriend got a spicy tuna and crispy rice app and spicy salmon roll. Everything was fast and tasty ! Would order again

Came here for dinner with my sisters after a spa day together (pre-COVID). This restaurant has been on my radar for some time and I was so glad that we were able to squeeze in some time for ramen. My elder sister raved about the purple fries here and she was absolutely right - they are delicious!! We each ordered a Tonkotsu Ramen and the broth was so flavorful and creamy with ample amount of perfectly cooked toppings. The space is a bit tight, but service was great and the atmosphere was fabulous. I'd definitely return again to try a different entree and order more purple fries! Nom nom!
No comment
Very attentive, amazing service. Recommend going during happy hour! Perfect spot for meetings or hangout with friends

I came here on a chilly Thursday night right before happy hour ended. I ordered oysters and the spicy miso soup. The oysters were okay but what I expected. I really loved the spicy miso! Felt great on my throat. When I arrived, it was pretty empty which I loved for dining alone. By the time I left, the place started to get a bit packed and the single waitress seemed overwhelmed. This place is so close to my apartment and I'm really glad I found it.
Very tasty , fresh and great customer service ! Was greeted and seated immediately . The pork dumplings were delicious also. I highly recommend this place .
Amazing service!!! Stumbled upon this place in my neighborhood. But worth coming back to again. Ask for spicy ramen
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Completely unplanned visit turned into one of the best culinary experiences I've had. We got the pork gyoza and Shoyu ramen with the works. Hands down one of my top 3 ramen places visited to date. The gyoza was crispy and thin skinned, the shoyu broth gave me chills. It was rich, flavorful and full of umami. The pork belly was full of fat and richness. I never really finish a bowl of ramen and I almost licked my bowl at this place. LoL..highly recommended and I will be back 200000%.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite ramen spots In NYC. it's always not too busy which is nice and we get seated immediately. The food is amazing and I highly recommend the gyoza and yuzu salt ramen. The drinks are great too and service is awesome
No comment

Solid ramen. Went during happy hour, where drinks and apps are $5 each. Enjoyed the outdoor seating, casual ambiance, and yummy pork tonkotsu ramen. Portions were good, oftentimes I cannot finish ramen bowls but this one was the perfect size for me.
No comment
No comment

IT'S BACK! Zest Ramen just reopened today after the pandemic and has been my solid go-to local ramen spot, happy hour or not, for years. I'm so happy to get my rolls and ramen and rice bowls again (hopefully they'll have oysters and clams again soon!)

Zest Ramen is one of the best ramen spots in the city. They currently have outdoor dining with heaters and dividers. Their vegetarian ramen is so underrated and comes with delicious tomato broth, enoki mushrooms, bok choy, corn, scallions, bamboo and fried onions... such a hearty meal.
Dropped in for late lunch indoors. Service and food are very good. There's outdoor seating and a lucky red maple by the entrance.
No comment
No comment
This spot is absolutely amazing! Huge portion with a. Free appetizer for happy hour. Staff is accommodating and friendly
No comment

LOVED THIS SPOT! FOOD WAS DELICIOUSSSS and there was a all day happy hour $4.50 on certain sakè & beers the service was great our server was such a nice funny man. Very nice, set up was perfect on the table. I'm soooo glad I came across this gem!
No comment

After a second visit, I think Zest Ramen is one of the best ramen shops in New York City, even before price considerations. Their tonkotsu ramen, with black garlic oil, continues to be amazing and distinctive. Their shoyu ramen, with a deeply flavorful broth, is wonderful, too. Zest seems to have iterated on their pork buns since our first visit; they are among the best we've had in New York City.

Absolutely love Zest!! I was so happy to see they opened back up and have outdoor dining. 2nd time here and I will definitely be back again. I had the Yuzu Salt Ramen with thin noodles instead of wavy. So, so flavorful and they give you the perfect portion. We also had the crispy & spicy appetizer. Crispy rice with spicy tuna on top, awesome! Love this place and will definitely be back.
This place is so good. My friend and I were visiting Chinatown and found this place best decision we ever made. The staff were so sweet and nice.
No comment

So happy. Memorial Day Weekend has been cold and rainy. A hot bowl of Ramen really hit the spot. Have been to Minca but wanted to try someplace new. Zest Ramen was comfortable insdoors and we were pleased to see they hadn't abandoned best practices even though COVID19 restrictions had loosened up a bit recently. The service was friendly and our ramen was delicious. So glad to have found this neat spot tucked away on the LES.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great place for ramen! The outdoor dining was warm with heaters. The ramen was delicious with great happy hour deals 4-7. Hot sake and ramen is much appreciated in the cold.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came in for happy hour on a weekday night! (Happy hour seems to last until 7 during weekdays) Got oysters, takoyaki, tonkotsu ramen, and some sakes. All were pretty good and i have to say i was very satisfied with $9 ramen! (The price seems to be normally $11-13 so i think even then, its not bad!) i had the plum sake which i really enjoyed, pretty sweet and went down easy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Every time I'm in New York City, I always make the trip down to a Chinatown to come here. This is by far the cleanest, friendliest and best ramen stop I've come across. The ramen come in a beautiful big bowl and if you get the pork belly it just melts in your mouth. The Happy Hour specials are cheap and honestly amazing but even the regular priced menu is cheap. I took my boyfriend here on a date and it's cozy and comfy especially at night. I definitely recommend you give it a shot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is okay. If you're hungry and want noodle soup, this will do. But if you're looking for authentic ramen, this isn't it. The ramen isn't very flavorful. It's more like basic noodle soup, with some of the usual ramen toppings. The noodles were thin and seemed similar to egg noodles instead of what you would normally find in ramen. The appetizers were decent but nothing special either. Service was fast, but I went when there weren't many customers. The people there were nice.

Run to this place! Delicious food, cheap lunch specials and warm, friendly service. Nice outdoor setup. Bathroom super clean and well decorated (sounds funny to say) with a chalkboard to leave your message!
Love this place! Everything is fresh and always consistent! Flavors are delicious, friendly staff, cozy vibe! Been coming here for several years. So glad they are still in business!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I only had the vegetarian one and was rather disappointed. You can make great vegi ramen without using tomato and creating a ramen like soup that tastes nothing like actual ramen
No comment

Came here on a Sunday because my boyfriend was craving ramen and we had my pup, Miso, with us. This was the only place I knew closeby that allowed dogs as they have a table by the door. Been to this spot numerous times for their ramen and it never disappoints. Love the flavor of their broth and the texture of their noodles!! The customer service at this shop is also phenomenal; the waiter even offered water for Miso! Best part, they have happy hour specials everyday from 3:30pm-7pm!! My boyfriend opted for the Tonkotsu Ramen ($9) and I got 2 pork buns ($8). We also ordered a side of chicken for Miso, which she thoroughly enjoyed. My boyfriend enjoyed his food and I thought the pork buns were delicious and well sized. You also get a cup of cold tea to end your meal which was very refreshing. If you're in the area you should definitely check this shop out!! Great food, atmosphere, customer service and prices! What more can we want from a restaurant in NYC?
No comment
No comment

This place is the tastiest ramen in the EV/LES area -- and yes, I say that knowing that Ivan, Momofuku, Ippudo, and Tastu are all just minutes away. Great ramen with bold, fresh flavors. Excellent customer service. I'm just sad they don't deliver to my place!
No comment
This place was such a delightful surprise. Everything was delicious + they have an amazing happy hour! Will definitely be back!
The ramen was okay, the pork had a lot of fat on it (there was a lot more fat than pork meat). The staff are very friendly. We checked into the restaurant on Yelp and got a free sake!
No comment
No comment

Ehhhhh.....ramen was okayish but it had a hint of game in the flavor which made me queasy at times. The broth was very nice but the meat was not tender and very thick and fatty. The service was very nice even on a busy day. The water they give you I couldn't even drink it. The cup or the water smelled sooo fishy. The atmosphere in the place smelled very oceany because of the oysters thank goodness we sat near the open door.
No comment

They were sooooo good. I've already came here twice with my boyfriend in the span of a month. The ramens were delicious, and super super reasonably priced. I will definitely be coming here again. Also, both times I was there it was the same waitress. She was very nice both times and very good service. Very attentive on refilling water.
Raman is yummy but I like the family style service more , very cozy and will go back again !

We came here for dinner.  We started with the purple potato fries (5/5) which was cooked perfectly and not over seasoned.  We also had the pork gyoza (2/5) which was not flavorful and you could tell it was likely the frozen ones bought from a store.  For ramen, we had the yozu salt (4/5) which was unique and you can really taste the yuzu flavor but not too overpowering, and the tonkatatsu (3/5) which was ok. The noodles and soup were ok but the pork belly didn't have much flavor.  The place is small and crowded and a younger crowd. Music is on the louder side but you can still carry a conversation.  Not the best place for ramen in the city but for around this area, it is OK.
No comment
No comment

Okay, so this is a quiet, and unassuming spot located on Eldridge tucked away next to Vanessa's dumplings and across the street from the Flower Shop. And so, this local gem doesn't get the attention it deserves. I highly recommend their happy hour appetizer specials, that's how I came to know this spot, their shumai, takoyaki, edamame, oysters, and skewered squid take the cake. But above all, jimmy, Jimmy is a gem of a human who'll remember you from years earlier and will cater his time and attention towards every patron with the same cadence. He's a sweetheart who know how to serve you and your group! 10/10 recommend for the value! THANKS JIMMY
No comment
No comment

We went to Zest Ramen a few weeks ago. I must say I enjoyed my dish. I got the Spicy Miso Ramen. It was very good and full of flavor. The pork belly was tender and full of flavor. The ambiance is great. The reason why I give it three stars is because the other types of ramen that my GF our family got were not as good. They were eating out of my bowl more than their own. They didn't have too much flavor and were a bit oily. Maybe it's better next time for some one else.

Went there during their "happy hour" from 3:30 to 7 and had their $9 ramen. Very delicious and affordable! Love ramen. Flavorful broth and nice fatty tender pork. Also had their takoyaki-nice and piping hot and delicious.
This is one of my favorite ramen spots in the city. We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, spicy miso ramen, and the gyoza. All were excellent.

Let me start off by saying the food is decent. I loved the broth, the noodles but the chicken was extremely undercooked and scary to eat. The workers tried to ensure me that it was cooked a special way, adding to why it was that texture-- but I know raw chicken when I see it and I am just happy I didn't end up getting sick. They gave me the fried chicken as a courtesy for my comments on the food, but honestly I just wanted my money back. Great place if you want to be unsure or what you're eating.
If you are looking for great ramen, this is not the place. However, If you are looking for mediocre ramen with good price, this is it. Plus, bun is good.

This is my go to place for happy hours. They have $1 oyster, $9 ramen and $4 for small appetizers. I tried most of their ramen, all taste pretty good. Even if you kiss the happy hours, the regular price is $13-$14, which is also reasonable.
No comment

Passed this place many times but didn't have the time until today and I'm glad I did.  I showed up during their oysters happy hour.  They had a great selections of oysters and the staff was very helpful explaining each oysters.  I went with 3 each making a dozen.  The oysters were fresh and you can taste the ocean.  I also ordered the spicy tonkotsu pork noodle soup.  It was not spicy but leaves a burn in your month.  The pork was tender and favorable.  The noodle is chewy, just the way I like it.  The best part is ramen was 9 dollars.  You can't find in midtown.  This place is always packed after 6 so I was there at 330.
No comment

Very cozy place with amazing food!!! The place is busy but the wait is not very long. We tried the spring rolls and the gyoza and I have to give it 5 stars! It was great! The tonkotsh ramen was delicious. Overall an awesome experience. Super affordable, the servers are very nice and the food is tasty. I will definitely be coming back

A really cute but fantastic ramen place. Its hidden on the inside streets and a tad bit far from the center of chinatown. This ramen place blew my mind. I grew up eating ramen and never really experienced the complexity of flavors that i experienced with this ramen. Shoyu ramen is truly the best one to get, we had the miso which was good but not great. The wavy noodles are reminiscent of the basic ramen we can buy at the supermarket but far superior in terms of freshness. This place is highly rated in my book. I will definitely be traveling back.  The bathroom and the restaurant is small but everything is really clean and your able to write comments on the bathroom wall (how fun!). Also the sweet server gives you a shot of green tea at the end. Overall a fantastic place for ramen. They also have $9 ramen happy hour from 3:30-7 which we missed but we will be back for.

My friend went back and told me that this time, her bowl was orange-red. They had actually given her spicy, meaning last time, they gave us the entirely wrong item. I find that strange since we each told our server spicy, and she repeated it back to us. We should have asked to confirm, but we were also the only two people in the restaurant, we ordered the same thing, and she couldn't get our order correct. Red flag.

Good ramen at a great price! Loved the spring rolls too. Service was great, ambiance was nice, seemed very clean, wasn't too crowded at the beginning of their happy hour, easy to get to from the train. It was the perfect meal for a chilly, rainy false autumn day. Will definitely be returning soon!
No comment
Not good. This is not ramen.  It is Chinese food that they are calling ramen.  There are so many places in the area for real ramen.  Don't bother eating there
No comment

I came here with a friend on a Friday night around 6PM, and it was already packed! We ended up sitting at the counter which was fine and a bit quieter than probably the rest of the restaurant. We came during happy hour which was great, and I ordered the spicy miso with wavy noodles. The food took a bit of time to arrive, but once it did, it was great! The noodles were perfectly chewy and there was a load of them. The meat wasn't very good though as it was hard, not flavorful, and thick; not the normal chasu. There was quite a bit of it though, four thick pieces. One of them was tender, the way it should be, but the other ones were really hard. It was also quite fatty, which I'm personally not a fan of. The egg was runny and awesome, but it wasn't flavorful enough either. There was one piece of fish cake, and lots of spicy oil. I liked how spicy it was! Service was alright as our waters were filled and dishes were cleared away appropriately. I may come back just for the cheap ramen, as $10.88 post-tax for a bowl of ramen is pretty much unheard of! I was mostly turned off by the pork belly, but maybe I'll try the chicken next time and it'll be better.

This place was so awesome! Went in on a whim looking for a good place to eat after not finding seating elsewhere and absolutely loved it! Happened to walk in during Happy Hour (3:30-7pm) and got $9 Ramen, $4 drinks and $4 apps! Awesome spot!

Good food and good price - def recommend the happy hour deal- you get one ramen and then any one drink/app for free and any after that are $5. They have ours door seating too, so you can drink hot sake when it's chilly out.
No comment

The Ramen was delicious I got the spicy tokotsu along with a fried chicken bun which was also good. If you like sweet alcoholic drinks the plum sake is the perfect choice ! Definitely would recommend and I plan on taking another trip. They also gave us a shot of green tea at the end of our meal which was a nice touch to cleanse my palette.
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Friday night with a couple of friends. It wasn't that packed so we got seated immediately. It is a very dim place but I didn't really mind. We ordered the spicy tonkotsu and spicy miso ramen which were both pretty good. The noodles had a nice chew to them and the sauce stuck to the noodles pretty well. The broth has a nice kick to it so if you're not a fan of spicy things I would avoid that. The pork was soft and broke apart easily and the egg was perfectly cooked. A lot of places don't know how to properly make a soft boiled egg but this place did it well. Overall I would definitely come back! For $12 a bowl that is pretty cheap and if you check in on Yelp you get free sake as well!

This actually seems like a legit ramen restaurant, and after eating here and it really is a ramen restaurant. It gives you ramen you would get in Japan and I'm not sure if it is the same quality as the ones in Japan but it is the best one so far that I've been too.
Everything was great. We had the fried oysters, pork buns and calamari appetizers which were delicious. Ramen was also great. We came during happy hour and the prices were great. Service was fast.

This was the best vegetarian broth I've ever had at a ramen restaurant. Normally, vegetarian ramen is so bland and boring. They make their veg broth with tomatoes and it is so flavorful and rich. My boyfriend loved his spicy miso pork ramen. We shared the fried chicken appetizer and it was delicious, too. I loved the dipping sauce. We will definitely be back soon.

First time going to this location it was a very intimate place. I ordered the pork belly bun and Miso Ramen. The pork belly bun was amazing, it had the sour carrot and white raddish with hoisin sauce, which reminded me of a vietnamese sandwich. The pork belly was super soft same goes for the pork belly in the Miso Ramen. Their Miso Ramen was delicious too. I've cleaned the whole bowl! Their soup was so flavorful and light. The staff was also extremely friendly. They even asked if I wanted to try samples of their special wine or champagne. They were very welcoming!
No comment

I tried dontaksu ramen and shoyu ramen so far. Both are decent. I prefer thicker noodle and more ingredients in the broth. If you like traditional thin noodle with simple yet deep broth, this would be the perfect ramen spot for you. The service was great and the location is close to Grand St. Station. I would've given 5 stars if the price a bit lower, considering I can get a pretty good $3 to 8 lunch around Chinatown area.

Zest Ramen is a hidden gem. The restaurant has a nice vibe-Cool music, high ceiling, and large seating areas. Authentic Japanese Ramen noodles are the best! I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.
We had a lovely lunch!  Great service, delicious dumplings and ramen, we will be back!
No comment
No comment

As all Australians know, we can't be without our Asian food. As Australians in NYC know, it's notoriously difficult to find good, authentic Japanese food at a good price. Zest Ramen nails it! A perfect bowl of ramen. Noodles, broth and the soft boiled egg take the cake. Their appetisers should not be overlooked either - the Takoyaki is my favourite. My partner and l came here twice in one week due to the delicious food and delightful service. Give them a go, and bring your friends too. Cheers!
No comment
No comment
The best takoyaki i've ever try. The place in chinatown is small but so confortable and cute, the restroom is very different with walls for you to write. The price is great and  lamen very tasty.

I will never forgive this city if we let this place die during these difficult times. They are doing $4 drinks all night and they have a cover for the rain and very affordable apps. The ramen is great and the pork buns are insane. The whole meal with drinks was $30/person. There are cute lights so it would also be a great date spot. Go, even if it's raining. I swear. I will never forgive you.

Love this ramen spot! We got the spicy miso and tonkatsu ramen. It was a very generous amount of pork belly, ramen and broth! You can also add extra ramen for extra 2$ and other ingredients such as seaweed, bamboo shoots, etc for 1$ extra. The broth is extremely rich and the noodles are perfectly cooked. The price is very decent for the LES; ramen from 11-12$. Their pork belly bun was really flavorful too, 2 buns for 7$. Overall, I love this spot! Will be coming back for ramen fix.
No comment

Their Shoyu broth is delicious. The service is friendly. But overall, their ramen fell short of greatness. The chashu was overcooked -- rough and chewy rather than tender, as one might expect from slow-cooked chashu. Noodles were slightly undercooked. But the prices are good and I may come back to try their other dishes.

This is my favorite ramen in the city. Its leagues better than ippudo, with quality ingredients, great flavor. Zest has not only great ramen but appetizers are spot on delicious. I would give this place 6 stars if I could. My wife and I have come every other week since we have been so lucky to find it. And the cherry on top...Dollar oysters

How does this place get such a a high review?  It serves subpar ramen coupled with basic frozen Japanese appetizers.  Throw some oysters into the mix (I'd check tags before trying) but kind of busy-ish for a saturday night.

column3: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Mediocre at best. Ended up getting the spicy tonkontsu. The broth taste was not great and the pork ended up being really chewy and hard to eat. Ramen meat should be extremely tender since it is a soup after all. It was almost like I needed a knife and fork to cut through it. Left 2 stars because the noodles were cooked nicely. I'm sure there are better options in the east village.
I've ordered their ramen delivery twice now, and will order again! It's difficult to face a successful delivery ramen, but this certainly was. Perfect for that comfort night in

Terrible service, will never return. Food is ok. Went on Saturday, not busy a few tables. Read the strong reviews and was looking forward to trying this spot but was very disappointed. Got our apps before our drinks, when we asked the server about them she quickly said oh yeah which should have been a red flag. She got my husband's order wrong so we had to wait for his soup while I had mine. The server only said a quick and half ass 'sorry' bc I kept making eye contact while we waited for his food. It was rushed so noodles were under cooked. He didn't finish it. And after all of that nothing was taken off the bill. So we paid full price for everything and still left a tip even though it wasn't deserved.

The space and ambience is nice and our waitress was extremely kind. She was very attentive. I ordered the chicken bun, takoyaki and ramen. Both appetizers were good. I got the spicy tonkotsu ramen, the broth and noodles were flavorful. I think the price was very reasonable for the items. The only thing I didn't like was the char siu in the ramen as it was kind of soggy and chewy. Almost like the texture of raw pork belly although I know it was cooked. They give you a little sip of iced tea at the end which is nice! Overall good ramen and ambience, I would come back if I was in the area and wanted some ramen.

How often do you come by a good ramen spot here in Chinatown?! This is definitely one of the places you have to come and try if you're craving ramen. I had the tonkatsu ramen. It's a MUST! The pork belly literally melts in your mouth, soup base wasn't too salty, and ramen is bouncy and chewy - just the way I like it. I highly recommend this place!!

column3: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: This is the best ramen place. I ate here to catch up with friends visiting in NYC and the ramen was tasty, flavorful and so enjoyable. Definitely coming back for more. Also amazing customer service and they give a shot of tea at the end.

Delicious! They have a vegan Ramen made with veggie broth and veggies! Delicious! The waitress was so kind and graceful! Highly recommend! I posted a video on Instagram and all of my friends want to eat here! I will definately be returning!
No comment

Zest Ramen is a hip place. The ramen is decent, but the appetizers made it a complete meal. Big fan of the purple yam fries and the fried squid. The ramen broth was clean, the noodles were average, the meat was good, and the egg was perfectly soft boiled. The service was amazing.
I love this Ramen spot. Probably one of the best in NY. The atmosphere is amazing! I can sit here and chill with friends for hours. And the server is really sweet and kind.
No comment

3:30-7p happy hour DAILY - can't complain about that! You'd think it would only apply to apps but they discount their ramen so that it's only $10! The fact that they also have oysters may be interesting to some.. but I love oysters so it's a-ok for me! As for the ramen, I ordered the tonkotsu - it came out quickly and was piping hot, broth was delicious but I wish the cut of the pork was a little thicker and it had more of a char on it. Otherwise, service and  music selection was good, atmosphere is cute - small, but you didn't feel cramped, and there was a steady stream of customers.

Had only an opportunity for a quick oyster happy hour while awaiting a takeout order nearby, but look forward to coming back to try more! Great $1 oyster specials and a cute and welcoming Asian themed atmosphere.

The place is small but nice and cozy. There is not that many options on the menu but what we got was chicken ramen. Omg! Like a home made. For only $11 and if you would like to add any other things its $1 extra. The staff is nice, very attentive and fast. Always checked on us if we are ok or need anything extra. Great location as well.
Cute and cozy place. We only have sake here and the sake came in a real cute can. It is 7 and 10 dollar sake and it came in a 200 ml can. Very cute, sweet place to hang out .
No comment

Just dine at zest ramen and I must say their ramen was super delicious my tummy was very happy. I ordered their yuzu salt, tonkotsu ramen and takoyaki for appetizer. Their tonkotsu was rich in flavors and the right amount of fat. Their yuzu broth was out of this world good it was savory and light with a nice hint of yuzu it's a must try. The noodle texture was fantastic, it was nice and chewy. Their appetizer was also very delicious especially their takoyaki. The prices for their ramen ranges from $11 to $12 which is relatively cheap compare to other ramen shops in nyc as well as additional toppings for just $1 to $2 extra! They also offer extra soup for just $5!! And extra noodles for $2! Their prices are unbeatable as well as their ramen broths. I can't wait to come back and try out all their other items on the menu. This place is definitely on my top 3 for best ramen.
What a awesome experience. People in here are happy, and also the place is very consent. Give it a try u will be missing out in $10 ramen, and 4.5 apps/ sake!! Super yummy
Blew us away! Went in with an open mind, without any expectations. Broth was rich and savory, noodles were fresh and firm, with a pleasant chewiness to every bite. Scores 4.2 out of 5 stars.
It was good. Yummy vegetarian Ramen. Hubby took meat based Ramen and says it was good. Reasonable price. Service was slow. Waited a long time but was worth it.
No comment

Came here for a weekday lunch. Had the Tonkotsu ramen + corn: broth was creamy and the black garlic oil elevated the flavor nicely. I liked that it wasn't overly salty where it could leave you feeling thirsty for a few hours after consumption. The thin noodles had good bite - nobody likes soggy noods, right? Egg was soft boiled perfectly. Pork belly could maybe be charred more so that the less lean pieces wouldn't make you feel as though you were chewing straight up mushy fat. Don't get me wrong, I love me some pork belly, but the three slices I had were basically all fat and no meat. The price was very reasonable and portion was great, most other ramen spots average $3-5 more per bowl.

I came to Zest Ramen on a rainy Thursday afternoon at 3:30 and had their $9 shoyu ramen for their happy hour. It was the best time to come and I highly recommend taking advantage of their happy hour deal. For the ramen, it was very filling and the broth was rich. The noodles were also good, along with the bamboo shoots and fish cake. If there's one thing to nitpick is that the pork wasn't as "melt in your mouth" type of deal you could get at a different ramen place. It's also a little bit on the salty side, but if you're on the sensitive end of that spectrum I think the spicy versions might help cut through that. Overall, very good service (kept filling up my water), great ambiance, and pretty good food!
No comment

We came here for dinner and were sat in the window seat - such a nice atmosphere! The service was excellent and the food was great. I had the veggie ramen with extra chili sauce. Husband had pork belly ramen which he said was the best he's ever had!

Checked the yelp nearby restaurants. this Zest Ramen actually come out on top section. It is new. We thought why not give a chance. The entrance looks nice compare to many other older Chinese restaurant in the town. Interior is not bad either. The waitress is Thai. She speak Thai to the chef. So I guess the chef is also Thai. We ordered shoyu and tonkotsu ramen and a squid skewer. We both like the egg in the ramen. My friend feel a bit salty of the tonkotsu, so she poured some water into the soup. My shoyu ramen is just right for my taste. We also like the squid skewer. Pretty good. I would come again if I am in this area.

I love this place. I got the spicy tonkotsu ramen and it was excellent. Usually when ordering spicy foods, I worry that if it's too spicy I won't be able to enjoy it. This dish has the perfect amount of spice! The noodles are a little bit on the chewier side which i like. The broth was rich and flavorful along with the pork! Definitely coming back here soon!

Awesome music!!! The food is also amazing! The service is quick ... and Pol (pa-aw) is like the superstar of this place! Leave a good tip!! The food is reasonably priced. They don't rush you out and she is patient with you and explains the menu items. We are from Los Angeles and came here twice on our visit. No doubt if we lived in NYC that we would be regulars!
Enjoyed their spicy miso ramen! Delicious broth, spicy but not too spicy. The pork however was far too fatty.
Great service, wide hours, and fun items. The shrimp with crab rolls and purple fries were very tasty, complimented well with sauces. Enjoyed and would order here again
Great spot. Went in for a quick bite before a show at Bowery ballroom. Delicious food, great service! Would definitely go back.
Excellent food at a reasonable price, good service. I had miso ramen and hot sake. Old school (as in 90's) music playing in the background. Not too crowded, which is really nice.

One of the better ramen places in NYC. Quite a steal for the price and the portions are just right. The tonkatsu broth was delicious and not too overwhelming as some other ramen places' broth. Definitely Try the takoyaki as it could just be one of the very best I've ever eaten. The waitress was super sweet and don't forget to check in on yelp for hot sake!!

Amazing service and even more amazing food! The prices were very reasonable and the atmosphere was pleasantly calm. We got the squid skewers, pork buns, Shoyu ramen, and Tonkatsu ramen. They all came out pretty quickly, and came out one after another as we finished eating a dish. I would definitely recommend trying this place!
The gyoza was some of the best ive ever tasted. The ramen is also deliscious. Definitely worth the walk. Good pricing and deliscious food. Super hearty! I loved it and it hit the spot!!
Oh wow. There are many Ramen options around, but this one is really worth a try! Mouthwatering broth, good ingredients and the best soft boiled egg.

I'm a fan. They have a good selection of ramens - pork, chicken and vegetarian. The service was efficient and attentive. I had the tonkotsu ramen with extra egg. It was rich and flavorful. The noodles were cooked really well. It is also very reasonably priced. This will be my go to from now on. Highly recommend it.
Just wanna keep up the 5 stars for them. The Tonkatsu broth was stellar, rich and flavorful. Perfect egg. Amazing noodles. Super fun service!

Some of the BEST ramen in the city! The staff is amazing, the food is amazing, and the music is amazing! They have a great happy hour menu too! In a city full of overhyped, expensive restaurants, Zest Ramen stands head and shoulders above the rest. Do your tastebuds( and wallet) a favor and come check out this fantastic ramen spot.
Ramen was great, one of the more flavorful broths that I enjoyed. I got the Spicy miso ramen, and it had the perfect amount of spice, enough to keep my mouth excited. Made my top 5 favorite places.
No comment
Great ramen at affordable prices. Have been here a few times already and will definitely go back!
V good, such a hidden gem in LES. Walked around a bit on the street because there wasn't a sign, definitely a must try if you love ramen.

A-MAZ-ING ramen here. Came with all the fixings for a great price! Service was top-notch too. Casual modern atmosphere mixed with traditional. Next time I'm in NYC, I'm definitely hitting this one up again!

Place is pretty cool. We ordered their ramen bowls and they were delicious! Bowls had so much going on in them it was cool. Oysters were only a $1 each and damn they were delicious. Be sure to check in on yelp there, they give you free sake if you do!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing food and amazing ambiance! Service was fast and very helpful. Great music playlist and great Sake options. The Ramen was hot flavorful and looked as good as it tasted. May become a little cramped when it starts to fill up but wait staff made sure everyone was satisfied and taken care of.

Nice comfy, cozy space, yummy appetizers. Mostly just posting a shout out to our waiter, who kindly allowed my mom to rudely bring in fresh coconuts from outside the restaurant and start hacking away at them with chopsticks and soup spoons. We had a good time here, gonna come back and try the ramen actually xD

Large portions for both rice bowls (Don) and for the ramen! Both were very delicious and fantastic for the price, $9 during happy hour which occurs between the hours of 3-7pm!! Quick seating and got the appetizer and our meals very quick! Constant service too for whenever you needed water and the waitress and hostess was very friendly! Be sure to check it out!

Amazing spot for happy hour! It's the deal of the century as far as ramen places go. I like that they had a chicken option without pork broth for fellow non-pork eaters. The apps were okay, but the ramen is really what was noteworthy. Booze was also on happy hour, so I got a couple glasses of beer on the cheap. Solid spot for dinner.

Best place you could ever go to for delicious ramen. The service is amazing as well as the food. I've tried the oysters and they are just as good. Great place to bring friends and family, I usually like going with friends and enjoying a good lunch.

Great Ramen costs $7 in Tokyo but for some reason its $17 for a small bowl in most places in NYC. Zest may not be the best bowl of Ramen you will ever have but it's only $9 from 3:30-7pm and its a proper Japanese sized bowl. The service is also really good.
Great ramen at the best price in the city. Hidden gem. You can get free sake if you check in through yelp. It's cozy and not too cramped inside

Nice cozy interior and great ramen.. unfortunately while I waited at the bar for my ramen I saw that the cook was placing toppings and noodles on my bowl with his hands, no gloves were used.  It was pretty disgusting to see. Also, had to bring my own lemon as they don't give them out unless is for oysters. They also make a scene even when I asked if I could buy the lemons. Lame ..

We had a great experience here! The waitresses were extremely kind and personable. The prices were very reasonable for NYC and the quality of the food. I can't believe one of the bottles of sake we got was only $10!?! I'd come back here again and again.
The best happy hour deals with $4 beer, sake, apps, $1 oysters and $9 bowls of ramen. The ramen is decent, oysters are fresh, prices are great and who doesn't love hot sake on a cold winter night?!

Good ramen, Yuzu ramen was very interesting with its flavors, however my friends's spicy Ramen was bland and unflavorful. It's adequate and good, but not amazing. The purple fries were great though. Music was cheesy and awful.

The best Ramen I've had in NY. Chashu melted in my mouth and the tonkatsu broth almost brought me to tears haha.  Not to mention the cute ambience and super friendly waitress.  It was well worth the walk in the freezing cold. 5 stars all the way.

Zest Ramen is nestled in an interesting place, but transforms the small space into a cozy ramen place. The ramen itself is very affordable for ramen restaurants in Manhattan, but is overall reflective of its slightly cheaper cost. However, the chasu meat absolutely saves the bowl, and is one of the most tender and flavorful bites I've experienced in New York. I would have liked to be able to customize spice levels more, given that they only have spicy or no spice.

Such good ramen! The broth was tasty and the noodles were the perfect texture! I got the spicy tonkatsu and it was definitely spicier than a lot of other ramen places but perfect for me. The service was great, our waitress was super nice and attentive. She even asked if the ramen was spicy enough and bought out extra spicy sauce for us. The place is kind of small but very cute.
Great local spot for ramen. Very warm and friendly place to catchup with friends over a bowl of yummy ramen.
Affordable delicious ramen. I had the spicy tonkotsu and it was delicious. Delicious pork broth with just a slight kick. Will come again to try the other ones!!
The best authentic ramen in New York City. Not surprising that they are among the top 100 places to eat at. I highly recommend trying their ramen.
Cute place. Easy seating.  Tonkatsu ramen was solid.  Pork belly very tender.  Will be back!
Went for happy hour. $9 for any ramen before 7pm. Apps were $4. Place was empty before 7pm but got very busy afterwards. Really good value. Will be back again soon.

Amazing Ramen. Incredible service. Definitely recommend!!!!! If I could give this place more than five stars...believe me I would. They are SO accommodating, whatever you want--they have it! Check in for yelp and get a free sake on the house! So amazing! I'm feeling amazing about this food, their sake, the vibe and all their staff. If you need a good ramen come here because you won't regret it!

So happy there are here! A recommendation from my son and he was right. Wonderful service. Spicy miso and shoyu ramen hit the spot on a cold Friday night. Charged a dollar for the chili sauce but it was good. Great playlist and the volume was perfect. Music and convers
No comment

It is straight up Tom foolery that this place isn't packed. We had the spicy miso and tongetsu ramen, both incredible, and a set of spring roles more perfect than I've ever had before. Seriously. It was juicy on the inside and crunchy/glassy on the outside. Plus a pitcher of Orion beer for $15. And incredible service. I can't rave enough, we had a perfect dinner here.
Good ramen and nice server but the fishy smell from next door was pretty bad. Will visit again in winter when the restaurant closes all the windows.
Really friendly staff, cool ambiance, great prices compared to other ramen joints around & they even have $1 oysters!

I stumbled into Zest Ramen recently with some friends and was truly amazed at how great the meal was! The prices are all very reasonable and the food is delicious. The waitstaff was so kind and attentive. I had the pork buns which came with the perfect sticky bun and a flavorful sauce. The spicy ramen is also great,  I recommend adding extra mustard greens and corn to take your meal to the next level. I will definitely be back!

This place was so cozy and cute. I had the Shumai and the Tonkuso Ramen and it was amazing, noodles were nice and firm and the broth was nice and light. This place is super affordable and a quick walk from Soho ! Will definitely be back
No comment
Very good vegetarian ramen. Get it with an egg and without the huge tomato. Happy hour prices are great if you can get there before 7pm.

A nice Japanese restaurant located not too far from the Manhattan Bridge. We had lunch here and opted for a selection of appetizers.  All of the food was quickly prepared, well presented and tasty.  The purple sweet potato fries and squid were our favorite dishes.  Our waitress was friendly and very patient. I'd dine here again.
Delicious, quick, and friendly service! Perfect for a freezing winter evening. The Tonkotsu was great - can't wait to come back and try the spicy miso!
This restaurant closed to my apartment..today i passed by and order spicy miso ramen & pork belly bun...i wanna say their pork belly bun so delicious...
No comment

Loved it. Best ramen place in Chinatown area. Had the cold dipping noodles, Tsukemen. Full of flavor. Great comfortable atmosphere. Hope more ppl will try this place cause I want them to succeed. Will definitely be in my regular rotation for lunch

Noodles were very underwhelming. The broth also left a lot to be desired. The music and atmosphere are fine, but nothing special. Overall not a great experience... you're better off waking a couple blocks to some of the other options in the neighborhood.
It's great without the ridiculous wait. So delicious, I've been twice.

Best. Vegetarian. Ramen. Ever.  The tomato-vegetable broth is flavorful--not typical of the weak, uninteresting vegetarian broths that taste like afterthoughts meat-based soup menus. This soup is a star, vegetarians and non-vegetarians will delight!

My Uber driver easily confused this place with Zest Sushi a few blocks away, but besides that, this place was a good ramen spot. It doesn't trump my favorite, but the Spicy Tonkotsu ramen was spicy enough that it enhanced the broth, instead of diminishing it. The pork belly was very good! It was crispy on one side and had soft fat on the other. Their Takoyaki is a surprise!! It's an appetizer, but it's probably the best takoyaki I've ever had!!!
No comment

Everything's already been said, so I'm pretty much just +1'ing everyone else's comments. Not usually a fan of straight noodles but apparently if they're thin enough it works. Great service. Their old-school R&B playlist is remarkably appropriate for a casual dining experience and shows good taste. That's my snobby way of saying I really liked their music. Their free shot of tea was like an oolong tea but with a subtle syrup-y-ness to it. This place is dope.

Best Pork Gyozo I've ever had. The texture and flavor had me coming back for more two days in a row. $1 little neck clams all day. Super fresh!! ramen was also delish!  I love the ambiance and the music is great. Incredible customer service. 10/10

I would give them 5 stars just for the music but on top of that the ramen was amazing. I had the spicy miso and my boyfriend had the spicy tonkotsu and we both loved it. Great vibes, great place 10/10 would recommend and go again!

I was really excited to see that Zest opened up a new location but just for Ramen. The food was super yummy, staff was unbelievably nice, the music is on point and the space inside is perfect for friends, dates and business lunches/dinners. Can't wait to come back and try new dishes. Also, SUPER happy they had a vegetarian dish but would recommend 2 more vegetarian variations of the dish in future. I think they should have a dope neon ramen bowl sign in their window. Good luck from me and my RISE coffee crew around the corner!

The food was great, the atmosphere was great. Everyone was so nice. The waitress gave us recommendations and everything we got was good. I will definitely come back. The price range of everything was really good compared to every other ramen place around.

Really recommend this place. Great value, ramen is around 12$ and beer starts at 4$. Authentic feel - much better than some nearby ramen restaurants that try to be more fancy. I really liked the music too! Service was friendly and efficient. We will be back.

This place is delicious, serves great portions, and is very reasonably priced. Not to mention $1 oysters during happy hour...bonus. The squid skewers were phenomenal and a great start to dinner. I ordered the spicy pork ramen and holy cow! Delish! The only thing that could have made it better is if the pork had been seared or charred and then put into the soup. As it was, the meat lacked an element that could have really put it over the top. The vege bowl was alright but had a very southwestern taste, almost like a chili. Definitely not my favorite. With all this and a dozen oysters we were only at ~$40! Very friendly place with a great vibe.
I have tried the miso and tonkotsu so far. Tonkotsu is really a must have! Very creamy and tasty broth with a touch from the pickles that brings out the flavor with more!

I passed by and come to try the ramen. This was good vibes. Music so so good. I got free sake for check in. I try Shoyu ramen. It's so different but was so testy. Even Pork belly bun was the best. Server so nice smile. I will come back again for sure!!
$9 happy hour for good ramen, can't get better. Also had fried chicken which wasn't that great. Nice  ambiance too.

Was recommended this place by a friend and I have to say that I really enjoyed the options. I had the Yuzu Salt because I was intrigued by the description. The ramen had a very distinct zest to it, as I should have expected from the name, but they really nailed the zest down. It had a very strong lemon/lime taste to it, but they somehow made it work in a chicken broth base. This wouldn't be my go to ramen but I do recommend a try. The other ramen like the Tonkotsu on their menu looked very promising and I would definitely give this place another try.
Really good food.  Enjoyed the tonkotsu ramen, pork belly buns and oysters.  Great friendly service!  Will return!

Cute spot and pretty good Ramen. Service is friendly, but short staffed. So things move a little slow on busy days. Overall the food is tasty, especially the sticky buns with shrimp. I went with my husband and 3 kids on a Friday night and it was suitable. I'd prob stop in again, but only if I'm in the area.

Pretty good ramen for the price. The tonkotsu broth was excellent, flavorful and rich, noodles was the thin straight variety, the charsu was a bit on the tough side.  The takoyaki was excellent, crisp outside hot and runny on the inside with a nice big piece of chewy octopus.  The purple sweet potato tempura was good, worth the try. Excellent service, will be back.

I'm a huge fan of ramen and try new places pretty frequently, but never write reviews. This place is amazing. Easily my new favorite spot in the neighborhood-- delicious food, friendly waitress and atmosphere, and great spicy miso. The price is great too. My friend and I each had a bowl and split an app and it was like $30.
No comment
Great Service. Very accommodating when I  explained  I didn't  know how to use chop sticks. Poured our drinks. The pork belly soup was delicious and the meat was buttery.  Nice quiet place

Update: I went back, and now I have I give it 5 stars because the broth and the noodles and other additions in the bowl were delicious, the place is cozy with nice decor, and the staff was super nice. I hope this place sticks around because I will be a regular.
No comment
Empty when we walked in but so good for such a reasonable price ! Homemade noodles are delicious, and so are the ramens !
No comment

I came to meet friend here at Zest ramen. I'm not a big fans of ramen but this place got me !! I also got spring roll and fried oyster for my appetizer it was very tasty. And then I got Yuzu salt ramen, a chicken was so tender and tasty with the citrus smell which is go very well with the broth. Service is very nice but they might need more server for sure due to their busy business.
This is probably the best ramen I've ever tried ! The place is really clean we only waited 10 min for the food .

It was heaven, me and my Wife went there after being married and was made to feel at home. Waiter and staff were very hospitable, kind, and funny. Made us feel welcome and the food was to die for. I had the land and sea wich is a NY Strip steak with scallops and WOW, it was the best steak I have ever eaten. Great experience, me and my new wife agreed to make this our anniversary spot. If u have not tried Tony D's I recommend you do cause it was phenomenal, 5 stars !!!

For the quality of ramen and the variety of options you can choose from, the happy hour deal (under $10 for a bowl) is probably the best deal you can find in town. While their ramen is solid, what makes this place above 5-star for me is their oyster happy hour selection. Also the restaurant is not too loud which makes it one of my fav restaurants in the city!!
Not so sure about the vegetarian ramen. It is literally a big bowl of tomato soup with noodles. If i wanted tomato soup id go to hale & hearty or something not a ramen place...
Love this place! The service is good, food is amazing and prices are unbeatable especially during happy hour. Perfect place to go on a date or out with some friends. Will definitely be going back!
The tonkotsu ramen at Zest was very flavorful and the chashu was delicious and juicy. The fried calamari was also very great and delicious.
Very underrated ramen shop in nyc! If you're looking for quality ramen on the level of Ippudo without breaking the bank, this is the spot for you. The Tonkotsu Ramen is the one to get!
So delicious and everyone who works there is always super nice! You can make it like a quick grab and go or like a sit down experience. Work highly recommend!
This place is great.  The server is super friendly and attentive. Ramen is great for the price. No complaints what so ever!
Great ramen, friendly service, and good music. We came as a group of four on a Sunday evening and sampled some appetizers before having ramen. Meal was great and I'll definitely be back.
All around great and authentic tonkotsu and gyoza. The free sake for a Yelp check in was great as well. Spicy is very spicy.

Went here cause didn't know where else to go at 8:00 pm. Ramen was excellent, service was extremely friendly, and reasonably priced. Oysters were also really fresh. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who's lookin for a nice bowl of ramen!!
Great ramen, and very friendly employees! If you are in the neighborhood be sure to give it a try, highly recommend.
Very good, flavorful ramen! The oysters were good as well, and the staff was very nice. I left feeling very satisfied with the meal.

This was amazing! We were going to another restaurant but decided to go here, it was a perfect choice. Not only was the food absolutely amazing (honestly I could eat a hundred of the pork dumplings) but the atmosphere and staff were amazing- and not overly expensive!
Simple and a real throwback on music when I visited.  Perfect for anybody that truly knows how to appreciate food and the heart that's put into a business.  Keep it up Zest!

Incredible service & great food. Their spicy miso broth is one of the spiciest ones I've ever had & they offer to make it spicier if it isn't spicy enough - still retains the flavor though. Small space that seats ~40, so it's intimate but still comfortable. A+ in my book

Quick and super friendly service! We went after the Chinese New Year Festival and it was a packed out with a one woman waitress crew! Food arrived swiftly to the table to satisfy our hunger and rid our chills from outside!
Good ramen, not many choices on the menu. supposedly not many people there, maybe the sign is too small. People may miss it

I absolutely love this place! Its prices (happy hour =$4 appetizers and drinks, $9 for an excellent selection of ramen, $1=2.50 for oyster & clams), its service (fast, efficient, helpful, and NICE!), its ambience (lights and staging: so gentle on the soul) and its food!!!!!!!! Makana and I had tonkatsu, his was spicy-chili (beware: it is just that) and mine, not. One more pork belly slice that most other places, fish cake (very thin, one more would have been nice), a generous amount of noodles (I was stuffed), and more, and this broth was simmered with love and attention to good dining. We had the purple yam tempura, seaweed salad, fried squid balls, squid tentacles tempura, pork belly bun: ALL EXCELLENT --and clams and oysters plated just as one would expect them to be: on ice and chilled to perfection.  The complimentary sake, served warm: of excellent quality, tempting us to try the other sakes: well worth the temptation. No: I do not know anyone associated with this restaurant; if I did, I'd consider it an honor to know people who understand the art of  treating their customers with  this caliber of quality and pampering.

Absolutely beautiful room; so tastefully done. Great execution on the food and the inclusion of some large format options is awesome for group dinners. There is this caramel custard dessert with orange peel I keep thinking about. I went back just for that after a dinner nearby one night actually.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Loved our valentines dinner at Casino. Started with the crudo and bread which were both great. Great cocktails as well but don't skip out on the wine list.

NYE Dinner review: formerly known as Mission Chinese now is a new establishment called Casino, the interior and ambiance is perfect for date night or just dinner with friends. They have front bar room and dining room in the back. I booked a last minute reservation for NEY and they were able to accommodate. Their staffs were friendly, start off with their appetizer crudo and fries, then we also hard 3 meals to split between, the clams pasta and the seafood lobster dish was my favorite, however the duck was overcooked but the flavor was good. Overall, I would still recommend this place.
Delicious and elegant. Perfect spot for my one-on-one catch-up with my girl friend. Lovely martinis and oysters!

The food was okay! Our server was very nice and service and food were relatively fast. On many of the dishes the sauces were a 4/5 but for instance the duck pate i had on the TOURNEDOS ROSSINI (2/5) wasn't the best i've had. My husband had the pasta with clam (3/5) and it was meh also. The NDUJA BREAD is a must! The ambiance was perfect for date night tho! Bottom line would I come again? Probably not, but it was a nice ambiance

I made a reservation here for dinner with friends who were in town. I wanted us to have dinner somewhere where the food was good and the atmosphere was fun and Casino hit the mark on both points. The food was high quality and the menu was a little different than what I've come to expect at NYC Italian restaurants. The service was incredible. Very attentive and friendly. It all felt like a modern take on old school New York. Can't wait to return!
Love the ambience here. The waitstaff was so accommodating and friendly. Love the cheese appetizer and Butter lettuce salad!
Food was great;,every dish was perfectly executed. Service was professional though a bit rushed.  Quentin was the bestest

The host is terrible, classist and mean. Will only let you in if he thinks you're "worth it" meaning chic and rich looking. He refused to take names down on list but immediately did for others. The food is mediocre at best. Don't waste your time and money here.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really nice spot for afternoon tea, a snack or drinks. There's a great view of the Hudson, perfect for watching the sunset in a calm and upscale environment. We had tea, hot chocolate, seaweed chips and beef jerky. The seaweed chips were amazing! The beef jerky was a little underwhelming because of the portion size - there were 5 small pieces.  The staff was incredible, it was definitely 5-star service. I'll be coming back to try their dinner dishes sometime.
No comment

No comment

No comment
No comment
