column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Modern Korean cuisine- the restaurant combines car showroom, library and dinning area.  Very unique vibe!  Food is decent and services are amazing.  The food mixes with Asian fare.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here a few weeks ago and they were very accommodating! My friend and I had dietary restrictions (seafood, gluten, and dairy) and they made adjustments to the tasting menu so we had no problem. The interior architecture and decorations are interesting to look at. We sat in a place that had direct views of Little Island so that was great. They also have little stools to put your handbags. The service from everyone is amazing. My only critique for improvement would be the interior lighting design because it wasn't great for taking pictures of our food (which makes it dark and bland looking) at night.
No comment
No comment
No comment

It is an interesting experience with high aspirations. However, I'm not sure the tea/snacks or service match the stratospheric goals of this space. While the Genesis showroom on the first floor and the tea room space on the second floor were both very beautiful (stunning, artistic and filled with meaningful intent) and our "guide", Brian, super informative, engaging, and amiable, the tea room service was lackadasical and slow albeit very friendly. Did not seem coordinated...I watched someone wait at their table for five plus minutes to get their order taken and there were only two other tables occupied at the time. A truly unique experience and we were happy to stumble upon it but don't expect to be back anytime soon.

Had the set meal.  It was very filling.  All the courses were nice and tasty.  The only thing I didn't care for was the soup.  Service was very good from the entrance with the hostess to the seating and service.  The set meal said 5 courses, but I think they said it was more like 8. The cheesecake dessert was very nice, but one of the other biscuits was even better.
No comment

portions are wayyyy too small, but the experience was magical and super unique. i loved the tea house and library they had. they treat you like queens from the moment you walk in, checking your bags, explaining each item delicately, and guiding you through the place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Exquisite dining, service, and ambience. A must! Fabulous tasting menu! Each course was thoughtful, layered with flavor, and most important delicious and filling.

So much more than a car dealership! The showroom was beautiful. On the second floor there is a library and restaurant. To go into the library section they ask you to take your shoes off, it's a beautiful space. They want you to use the second floor as a lounge, if you need to cool off, drink/eat something, or use the bathroom.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Opening night at a pretty exclusive restaurant in New York! Such a great experience. Genesis House Restaurant is part of the larger Genesis House experience that opened in The Meatpacking District. Curated by Onjium from Seoul, there is nothing lost in their Michelin Star translation. Our entire party ordered the Tasting Course. It was out of this world. Each course bringing new tastes and textures to our palates. The staff was incredibly attentive as you would expect. The preparation for the opening was obvious everywhere. Joseph, our lead server, had been training for 4 months. He described the training as a full Korean education. Easy to get to, and worth a trip from anywhere. Enjoy it!
No comment

Kinda an unusual experience, as it's basically a car gallery (not a dealership - although staff are knowledgeable about the cars). The restaurant is pricey, but the bar and library is a welcoming and calm space. There's also an outdoor space that's very nice with comfortable furniture.

Beautiful restaurant with views overlooking New Jersey with excellent service.  The food, however was a mixed bag.  The salad was fine, however it has a sweet thick mayonnaise based dressing plopped below the salad.  It was not mixed in, probably for good reason.  The tuna was very good, as were the bass and chicken entre. The tofu with rice was good, but bland. The mascarpone desert was more savory than sweet (Bampyeon).  It was not very good.  The cocktail - called something like concept 261 -- was overly sweet.   Though they call this fine dining, it is not.  A lot of time is spent on concept, but too little on flavor and presentation.

I wanted to really like this place and looked forward to trying Genesis House's set menu. However, I left quite disappointed. The interior and venue was stunning (though night time lighting was minimal), the wait staff were great, and the food was just okay -- nothing spectacular. However, the $150 price point didn't justify the just okay food. The first dish (suranchae) was probably the only course that was actually good, while to dessert was interesting. The rest were uninspiring for the price point. The tuna was overpowered by the cilantro, the grilled sirloin was seemingly a better presented Korean bbq dish, the tofu rice wasn't anything special.

You must try this location. I traveled from Dutchess county, NY, to the city since my husband was looking to invest in a vehicle. Ema was very detailed and engaging. She even recommended this fantastic restaurant where we went and had drinks after our sit down. Outstanding service from both Ema and the restaurant. A must-try location

A great environment designed to experience Korean culture and cuisine. Starting out with a curated tour enhances the overall experience followed by a well edited tasting menu. Spectacular  service all around combined with a zen like atmosphere make for a memorable exploration.
No comment
No comment

stopped by the genesis house for dessert after dinner.. what an experience! from the ambience, architecture, food, to the staff.. Adam as well as a lovely bartender served us at the bar where we enjoyed the special dessert for two. Afterwards, we were able to peruse the tea room and were invited back by a number of staff members to come back for tea (especially during sunset). As we left, Troy gave us a great tour of the showroom--answering all of our questions with ease and great knowledge. He even showed us the event space in the basement, which is definitely worth dropping in for. Check out this location for a fun and experiential night!
No comment

At first I wasn't sure if I had arrived at the correct place because of the sparse showroom with cars around the edge. They check vax status at the door and escort you up to the second floor. From photos I thought the ceiling would be higher but it was very pretty. Little slabs of wood were aligned to mimic a ceiling. We started with 2 different drinks which were all soju based. They had quite a strong alcohol scent/taste which took some getting used to but got better as the ice melted. Then we were presented with the food menu which was immense. We didn't know what to get. We considered getting one tasting and a few a la carte items but you cannot split the tasting. There were too many options so we went with the tasting. I'm glad we did because you could sample their offerings. Everything was presented beautifully and overall, their dishes had a subtle flavor. If you like your food salty and flavorful, this probably isn't the restaurant for you. I don't remember everything we had so I'll highlight my favorite ones. The amuse was a refreshing vinegar drink which was followed with anju - dried beef, fried fish skin, etc. Would have been great with beer. Then we had a delicate seafood dish with a pine sauce that we both really enjoyed. It included half a scallop and a slice of abalone. We wanted to lick the bowl and get every drop of the sauce. There was a impressive  looking beef dish presented in a huge metal bowl. It was chewy but delish with the perilla leaf. For our dessert, we asked for the chestnut tiramisu which was HUGE. It was delicious but one would have been enough for the two of us. The tasting was $150 each and the drink pairing would be another $95. I recommend the tasting for a special occasion. The food and service were excellent.

Great dining experience at Genesis House. Beautiful interior and concept. The service here is top notch. They will take care of you and very pleasant. Food is yummy, would definitely recommend the wagu steak and forgot the name the seafood staggering dish with white pine sauce and the jerky. Would just recommend skipping the chips, nothing special but the jerky is delicious. Also the seasonal apple kimchi is very very good.

I had one of the Best meals/experience of my life here at Genesis House. My friend and I got the tasting menu and drink tasting menu. We sat at the bar and received top notch service from Adam, our bartender and everyone that we came in contact with. What a Special Treat!!
Everything was excellent from start to finish. The mix of old and new recipes rocked our world.
No comment

I came here on an Amex Concierge recommendation.  The location and restaurant are beautiful.  The service is on par with the best.  The food is likely some of the worst I've ever had.  I would give it a 1 star based on the food.  Plus, it's prix fixe menu (which I'm actually a fan of).  you get 2 tasting choices.  2 people, 2 cocktails, 1 bottle of wine and 2 tastings were in excess of $700.  Again the service and location are amazing.  The place was 1/2 empty on a Saturday night.  Should tell you something.  Missed the mark.

The place is beautiful, but half empty. And now I know why. The food is just expensive and not good. I've tried most plates mentioned in the other reviews and left hungry and disappointed. Definitely not worth the money.

I am overly impressed with this restaurant. I was honestly skeptical. As a korean, i walked in with no idea what this place was and had very low expectations. Thought it was just another high end white washed korean spot. Its definitely not your authentic korean food but definitely has the korean touch with a twist. Prices are high but you get a decent amount of food. What really impressed me was the service. From the downstairs people, to the hostess to the servers, everyone was so kind and helpful with bright personalities. The venue is beautiful. I recommend you try this place atleast once. The deserts made me feel like i was reliving my childhood again! Koreans will see why
No comment
No comment

A good Korean fusion place to try!  I think it is in a good location and services were good. I am not a big fan of Korean fusion dishes. However, their course dishes were better that I expected! Probably revisit there!
My new favorite restaurant! We had the tasting menu and it was absolutely amazing. Thank you to Leslie and the welcoming and professional bar crew for a very special dining experience.

Everything was so mediocre and came out cold. I even asked if something could be sent back to be heated and it came back lukewarm. Prices super high for food lacking flavor and just not tasty at all. It was so try hard it was awkward. Do not go. Sorry :/

It was very nice. The view was great, and the drinks were strong. The waitress was super nice. She gave us everything we needed. Very disappointed with the guy at the tea bar though. Paid no attention to any client, was on his phone the entire time. Gives a bad impression to the restaurant especially with such nice staff and great food.
No comment

We absolutely loved Genesis House. The servers were lovely and insanely attentive. The food was delicious (plenty of vegetarian options). Their dessert was to die for. Wrap up with dinner and chill out in the tea house. It's a really beautiful sanctuary. Great date spot!
More than a restaurant, it's a deep dive into Korean culture. Curated recipes for historical flavors. Friendly, efficient service.

8 of us had dinner and we actually ordered everything in the menu including deserts!! They were all great and my personal favorite was the beef.  The food here is the best authentic sophisticated Korean foods in NYC in my view. The service was excellent by everyone including Kevin our server.  Starting from General manager Kevin, all the staff were very friendly and professional.  I am looking forward to hosting many of my NYC local friends and out of towners at this beautiful space.  The Restaurant is located on the second floor of the beautiful Genesis House.  The first floor has a display of Genesis brand cars.

We had an amazing experience during our visit. Joseph S. was able to provide an in-depth tour of the entire facility and explained the philosophy and company culture behind the cars, atmosphere and restaurant. It was a beautiful experience and made us appreciate the brand even further. Incredibly excited to look at our genesis car options!!

Genesis provides 5star service the moment you step into the amazing 3floor facility. The staff was very happy(with a )to help, educate, guide you for a night to remember. We ordered the seafood salad+ japchae + waygu which every dish exceeded our expectations. So good, had to try their dessert which again delivered. Service/food/venue is five stars!
No comment

This isn't what it looks like. The first floor is a show room for the latest Genesis models. But it's not a dealership. The staff is there to simply share information about the latest technology and updates in the models. The staff were informed and welcoming, very knowledgeable. The second floor is what can't be missed. It is a place of relaxation and peace. The tea room is elegant and well stocked on Korean culture. There is a beautiful bar and wonderful restaurant inside on the second floor as well. Outside there is a patio that looks out on the harbor and Little Island. It is the most peaceful and gracious space to study, or meet with friends. Well designed, beautifully thought out.

Did not live up to its hype. I expected much better food for the price of each dish. Plating was also subpar. Wagyu was cold. I wouldn't recommend this place. Service and ambience however were amazing

One of the best dining experiences we've ever had in NYC or elsewhere for that matter. Every dish and drink we had was scrumptious.  Service was amazing too. We'll definitely be back again and again and again!
Fantastic experience across-the-board Including architecture tea and of course the fabulous cuisine

It is hidden in this wonderful building. A few steps up to the first floor and you get greeted by a wonderful hostess. We didn't have a reservation but were able to sit at the bar right away where Leslie took amazing care of us. We had the sample menu and one course after the other was better and better.
An experience not to be missed!  Korean food straight from the royal court with emphasis on entertaining the guest with an orchestration of flavors and a story behind every dish.

Been using yelp for more than a decade, first time writing a review. I'm a foodie, and I have been to many restaurants in Asia and the US. Very disappointed,  over priced , staff lack of training. So far far away from a fine dining or regular dining. Such a shame.

Ordered the tasting menu and drink pairing, but was incredibly disappointed. The wagyu was chewy and overly fatty (not the marble wagyu you'd get anywhere else). The main dish is simple white rice. The drinks were late to every pairing and disgusting in some cases. At the end of the night, we ended up spending over $300 a person for not mediocre, but bad food and disappointing service. I would not eat at this establishment, there are so many amazing Korean places in NYC.
No comment

Genesis house was delicious! The food was amazing. Every dish was better than the next. The seafood salad was incredible. The staff was very attentive and lovely. Katie was our server and she was awesome. She gave us amazing advice on what to order. She gave amazing suggestions and every dish was delicious. I will be going back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

We visited Thep Thai for lunch on a Saturday afternoon before visiting the Guggenheim museum. The outdoor area is warm, cozy and well decorated. We were a large party of 6 people and were seated on one of the community tables. The food was perfectly spiced and the portion sizes were great! We got the pad kee mao, basil fried rice, pineapple fried rice and the Massaman curry for all of us to share. Even though the place was crowded the service was wonderful and the server kept checking in on us.

Super cute thai spot. We came on a Saturday for lunch and there was no wait. The apps were summer yummy. The puffs surprised me with how good they were. The pad thai and short rib massaman were very flavorful and beautifully presented. I'd want to come back to try more of the menu.
No comment
No comment

Fast service and good quality food! My pineapple fried rice was beautifully presented in the pineapple. I was hoping for cashews but they were ground up and I would have liked more rice, but great portion of shrimp! The rose Thai iced tea didn't have milk but tasted amazing sweet and creamy!

This was such a cute spot to get dinner and catch up with my friend! The exterior of THEP Thai is super pretty, with tons of decorative flowers and lights. They offer seating both indoors and outside on the patio (once everyone in the party has arrived). My friend and I arrived around 5:15 on a weeknight and there were ample seats available. The interior of the restaurant had a really nice ambiance as well, though the lighting was much darker than we expected and honestly I would've preferred a bit more light lol. They have a scannable menu and everything looked really good - I really appreciated the detailed photos they included for some of their most popular dishes. I ended up getting the cashew king dish (a type of stir-fry) with tofu & rice and my friend ended up getting the braised short rib udon bowl. We were both pleasantly surprised at how quickly our food was brought out. The portions are fairly large and we both really enjoyed how flavorful our dishes were. The menu also contained many options to accommodate gluten-free/vegan diets. Overall, service was great and I'll definitely be back to try some of their other dishes - this restaurant definitely has one of the most extensive Thai menus I've seen in a while :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped by with a group of friends on a weekday around 7 and we were able to get seated in one of the outdoor spaces without a wait. We started off with some cocktails which were nicely made. For Entrees, we all got the pad kee mao with various proteins. Pretty standard but probably could have used a touch more seasoning and basil. Service was quick.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

You get here and they definitely give off a modern aesthetic to the restaurant. However, the food itself feels so delicious and so well thought off, making it feel like they focused on all aspects of making a successful restaurant. I definitely would recommend this to anyone who wants to have a fancy lunch/dinner and in the mood for some good Thai food! Also drinks are fun and tasty! They are unique and of course, can't forget your coffee based cocktail in the drink menu!

I ordered the drunken noodle with a side of edamame. I specifically asked them not to put any eggs in it. When it arrived I eat the edamame first before opening the drunken noodles. When I open it there was obviously eggs and I figured I can call them and they will just sent me a new one. But that's not what happened. When I called they told me they are closed for lunch and will reopen for dinner at 5pm and to call back then to let them know. An hour I have to wait? If they made the mistake,) They should have made the effort to get the dish to me correctly. So I called grubhub to refund my order for the noodles. I gave 2 stars only because I did eat the edemame.
Delicious & fresh take on Thai food because it is inspired from the Northern region. The portions are shareable, the flavors are fresh and I can't wait to try more items on the menu next time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

THEP brings strong and bold flavors of Thailand to the UES. I ordered the Pork Belly Clay Pot and it was seasoned to perfection. The fish sauce they give you with the dish complimented the flavors of the pork so harmoniously. The menu here can be a little daunting but our server that day was so helpful in helping us decide what to eat that day. We sat on the outdoor patio as the weather was lovey that day and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. THEP is a great place for some authentic Thai flavors.
No comment

This palace has some good food and decor. It was easy to find a table on a weekday for dinner. We got the tom kha soup and it was delicious. For the entree I had their shrimp basil fried rice and I really liked it. The vegan drunken noodles was also good. Service could be better but it's a good thai place in the city and I highly recommend this spot.
No comment
Absolutely delicious food and great ambiance. This is a local spot that has style and gets really busy. Drinks are tasty and pretty. Love Thep!
No comment

I ordered the Shrimp pineapple fried rice ($20) and found it to be kind of lacking in terms of flavor and size. It wasn't bad but the rice could def use more seasoning and maybe a bit of heat, and the shrimp honestly didn't taste like it was seasoned. I know these were NYC prices but I say the portion was pretty small because I don't think I've ever finished an entire order of fried rice by myself from literally anywhere but it was very doable with this one. I will say that there was a ton of shrimp in it so I guess you get your value through that. Everyone I was dining with did think their dishes were pretty good though so maybe it was just the rice that was mid idk.
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: I honestly didn't think this place lived up to its hype. Yes, it's super pretty but food wise I was not impressed. My opinion is solely based off the pad se ew and lychee Thai iced tea. Pad se ew was severely bland and lychee Thai iced tea was literally lychee water. If you're going to get either of those items, don't. Also got green curry which was on the better end.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Excellent service, delicious menu, pretty place, reasonable prices! Varied food choices. Just one gripe: don't take reservations!
No comment
Good thai! A little pricier than other places with better dishes but overall a great place for dinner! Chicken Khao Soi was delicious!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was my second time at Thep and it did not disappoint! We got the pineapple fried rice, avocado Massaman curry, and the Spicy Udon noodles, all vegan. The Massaman curry was very good. I loved how the pineapple fried rice was in a pineapple, but it was not my favorite dish. The Spicy Udon noodles, were true to the name of the dish and quite spicy, but also very tasty. Everything is also very reasonably priced and there are many vegetarian options.
No comment
No comment

My new favorite Thai spot in NYC, while thai villa might have been featured on Suits everything about this place was fresh, vibrant and delicious. Their decor was the perfect marriage of cold and festive meets Thai cuisine. We started our meal with Tom Yum Soup and chive masaman dumplings, they both were so delicious and set the tone for the rest of the meal! We got the khousa which were yummy, cause who does not love noodles in a curry broth, however the curry powder flavor was a little overwhelming. We also got the avocado massman curry which was my favorite, it immediately warmed me up and was so flavorful. Pad Kee Mao was delicious as expected just did not like that it had large pieces of bell peppers. Cooled the meal down with some lychee thai iced tea. Service was attentive and so quick, would definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
Large portions and pretty good food. Both items were good. The Tom yum was a bit heavy but that's expected
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Oily, Salty and just a ton of noodles. This place is so overhyped couldve gotten the same quality from a street vendor. Save your money and find another Thai place
No comment
Rude waitstaff, would not come here again. Called to make a reservation, would not take my name down, then when I came in told me it would be a 20 min wait and there's nothing they could do.
No comment
No comment

Hands down the best Thai food I have ever had. Flavors were super authentic and extremely savory. Nice thin cuts of meat, perfectly seasoned. Basil fried rice with chicken was amazing too, not too overpowering of basil, just perfect. Great date night or comfort food. Also ordered Pad Kee Mao with tofu. The noodles and dish overall were amazing and flavorful. Great vegetarians options as well. We go here multiple times a year.

Cute little cozy spot on the UES. Everything was decent and I appreciated waiter asking if we had any food allergies (don't hear this often). I absolutely loved the holiday decor. There was a wait time for about 10 minutes (Thursday). Although I would've loved to be and eat comfortably, I wasn't able to due to it being cold. Hence the reason why I did not give it a 5 star. We were seated outside and although it was covered, it definitely wasn't insulated enough. Almost all of us ate with jackets on. I hope management looks into this matter.
No comment

Host is PATHETIC! Unwelcoming and insensitive. All this experience was after joining the Yelp Wait List and our table was 'supposedly' ready.  I went there tonight with my 2 year old on stroller and 7 year old. It's 49 degrees outside. He made us wait out in cold for more than 20 mins. He was apparently annoyed that we were not taking outdoor seating. He was least bothered when we asked him if we could wait inside. He did not even offer us to wait in one of their outside booths that were mainly empty and the one he was asking us to sit right from the beginning. We left and went to another nearby restaurant 'Up Thai' which is super awesome and we were glad we took that right decision. Thep Thai, take some lessons from your neighbor competitors. NOTE: We have been to Up Thai numerous times before. We just wanted to try this restaurant for this change. Bad pick but ultimately we corrected our mistake right on time!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

For an early Sunday night dinner, my friend and I visited THEP Thai, which I had wanted to visit for a while after seeing the beautiful interior. I'm glad it was an early dinner, because later on during our meal, the restaurant began to quickly fill up. However, there was an equally nicely decorated exterior with enclosed heated seating. My friend ordered the drunken noodles and I got the pad thai, which we both immensely enjoyed. She even went as far to say that they were the BEST drunken noodles she has EVER had and intends on returning in the future.

No comment

Consider myself pretty knowledgeable about legit Thai food and have been all over the country, and I don't understand the high reviews for this place. We ordered takeout and everything was like bad strip mall Thai in the Midwest. Maybe I'll give it a try and actually go there because I must be missing something.
No comment
No comment
Great Thai food! I think I liked the pineapple rice because it had so many different ingredients such as carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, and of course pineapples!

Yum yum yum! The food here was so tasty! I'm going to go out in a limb and say the short rib massaman was likely the best Thai dish I've ever had. We ordered the chicken dumplings, chicken curry and the short rib massaman. Everything had unique flavors and was lovely. I would 1000% come back!
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Though you can't make a reservation, I love this restaurant. It is very noisy but the food is good.
No comment
This place is a gem in the upper east side. Decor and service is great and food is amazing. This is definitely one of the Faye night restaurants in the area
No comment
No comment

Ordered the same Queen of Siam basil with seafood. Told the waitress I wanted it spicy so she convinced me to do medium and not hot. Glad I listened because this time is was a really nice kick! Could use a bit more shrimp and other seafood but overall very good. Also ordered the Tom kha soup. Surprisingly sweet...didn't really like that.
I love the shrimp pineapple fried rice. I get it every time I'm in the area. The interior looks cute too. A nice place for a casual lunch or dinner. They even decorated their outdoor seating
No comment

No comment
No comment

This very cool trendy place offers both indoor and outdoor seating. Located in the Upper East Side of Manhattan, we decided to sit inside. We were there during happy hour before 7pm and had a Lychee Martini $8, a good price for NYC. I started with the Chive Pancakes $10, then the  House Salad with peanut dressing $11. Both were so delicious. For my entree I had the Sweet Potato Pad Thai $20.  It was good and different but I felt it was heavier than traditional rice pad Thai. The decor of the restaurant and the presentation of the food had so much style. The service was very attentive.

Incredible!! I don't normally order drunken noodles but after talking to our waiter, his recommendation swayed me and I had no regrets! The atmosphere, service and food is absolutely worth the wait! (We waited ~30 minutes on a Wednesday evening) and I would 100% recommend to anyone in the area!

No comment

The chive pancake was amazing. Not at al what I expected but far better. I've never had chive pancakes in this form but it was exceptional. A must get. The soup noodle dish was amazing with the mock duck. I would absolutely get that again. The sweet potato noodle wasn't my favorite but mostly because I wasn't expecting it to be straight sweet noodle but that's on me for not reading.

The food is simply amazing! We came here on a recommendation from a friend and we weren't disappointed. They have a variant if options, our server was very honest with her suggestions. Although they were busy, since it was a Saturday evening, we didn't feel cramped and not too noisy were you couldn't talk and enjoy.
This is the best Thai food I've had in the city so far! Had to wait about 30 minutes but it was worth it. The pad Thai was sweet and so tasty. The restaurant was beautifully decorated as well
No comment
No comment

I had a wonderful experience at Thep. Despite being very busy, we were seated immediately. The service was incredible, and the food was equally great. Portion sizes were amazing considering the reasonable price point. Definitely the best Thai spot on the UES. Highly recommend!
No comment

Hard to miss on the corner with white flowers covering the entire building and interior seating. Once inside, they have hanging plants and lights. Beautiful decor and very cozy; I loved the look they were going for. The dishes were plated with care and very photogenic. We shared the appetizer platter but the egg roll was the best out of all of them; my sister disagreed. She liked the shrimp one the most. I felt it was too fishy and the chicken one was the lacking Thai flavors. Nana loves crab rangoon's. The pandan infused chive dumplings were delicious, it had a coconut milk sauce and very fresh noodles...yum! The pad see ew with veggies was another hit and it's my fav Thai dish. My sister got the beef udon and enjoyed it. Nana got the lemongrass pork and it was tender, flavorful, but a huge amount of food so share the entrees because it's too much for one person. It came with a side of rice; purple, forbidden rice, and coconut milk. Recreating it at home because it was very good. The servers were attentive, cleared the table out constantly, and brought water out each time we finished the bottles. They seem very happy as a group and enjoy working together which was pleasant to see. Sister ordered the red hot lady and thought it was tasty with the hibiscus rim. Sodas are not refillable.

I've ate here numerous of times and for some reason have never left a review but this place deserves all the great reviews. Hands down one of the best Thai restaurants in New York. Truly the most flavorful food ever and delicious drinks. The ambiance just takes everything up to a whole another level. My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate our four year anniversary and we were so happy with everything. We shared the thep platter and had the pad kee mao, he had it with duck and I had it with tofu. I love spicy food and it had the perfect amount of spice. I can't even stop thinking about it and I'm so happy I have leftovers to now warm up for lunch today!
I love THEP!! Beautiful atmosphere, delicious food (vegetarian duck, yay!), good service. Everything is on the pricey side, but worth it. Even the outdoor seating is adorable!
Great service and tasty menu, the atmosphere is great too and located in a prime location. Perfect for date night

Great Thai experience- from food to drinks to the ambiance- it was all worth it. We started with the fresh rolls and shrimp dumplings. Both excellent and refreshing. I don't think you can go wrong with any noodle or curry dish. Amazing flavors and textures. Service was fast. Would def recommend!

I loved the atmosphere here! For starters, we sat in their outside pods with our pup which was great they allowed it. The food came quick and had amazing flavors. My favorite was the crab fried rice! I would definitely recommend if you are ever in the area.
No comment
Good selection of items to choose from! Food came quickly and the server was attentive. Pad  thai was decent but could use more flavor.

Really nice ambience, great staff and service, the food was very aesthetic but taste wise, it was okay. For appetizers , we got the Chor Muang and their current winter special, Chive Dumpling Massaman, which were both vegan! For mains, we got the shrimp pineapple fried rice and vegan pad thai with tofu. I felt it was a bit pricey, came out to be around $80, but it was nice to try for my first time.

Really great ambiance inside, nice lighting for an intimate atmosphere. We brought some family that were in town and they were very impressed. I ordered the chicken pad Thai, loved it--would also recommend any of the salads.

THEP was so so good. We went with our kids on their first trip to NYC and they devoured everything. We ordered a number of appetizers and then shared some curry. Everything was fantastic and they were very accommodating of our young kids as well.
The place looks a lot bigger in pictures but compared to other nyc places it's decently spaced. The short ribs and Thai iced coffee were incredible and a must have!
No comment

Loved this Thai place!! We stopped by before going to the met for a quick lunch and THEP did not disappoint. The service was insanely fast, we got seated right away and food came out within 10 minutes. The quantities were also huge! Make sure to review on google to get free Thai iced tea. Our server came over often to check on us as well. Loved the flavors of the food and I hope to come back again!
No comment
No comment
Personally drunken noodle was better than pad see ew. Must try if you are around this area. Pretty interior nice service and delicious food!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came by this spot with a friend for an early dinner and it was very nice with ample indoor and outdoor seating. The menu has plenty of vegetarian options which was great. I had the green curry with mock duck which was very interesting (a bit chewy, but still pretty good). The curry flavor was the right amount of spicy. It was a very hot day so I wish our beers were chilled, but overall, the food and ambiance is very pleasant.

Truly loved this place. Hard to find a place where everything ordered was mindblowingly good. But definitely found that here! The drinks were amazing, and so was the tom kha soup, the beef, the pork bun, and everything else we ordered. Can't go wrong here!
No comment

Met a friend for lunch a week ago. He had pad thai and I had pad see ew. Both portions were good-sized. Enough for leftovers at lunchtime. The flavor was also really good and the vegetables were cooked nice. Cute decor and friendly staff.

This is one of those spots that as soon as you walk past it, it makes you want to go inside and hang out. There's a lanai-esque area at the front that's covered in hanging flowers and decor and the inside is the perfect cozy restaurant with a bar area and also tables to sit at. The menu is extensive and you have so many options to choose from and from what I tried, everything was delicious. For the table, my friends and I ordered the chive pancakes, chicken satay (my favorite) and papaya salad. I ordered the spicy udon with chicken and it was delicioussss and my friend ordered the Panang curry which was also delicious. I sadly don't live in New York so I can't go there often but lord, I'd be there all the time if I lived there!
No comment

Excellent and delicious food! The service is fantastic and the place is very nice. Everything we ate was yummy and my favorite were the noodles in the drunken noodles. Highly recommend when you're in the UES.

The very best khao soi in upper east side. Chicken on the bone with a great broth. Wonderful declaration with hanging plants throughout the restaurant. Can't get more Thai than this spot. Service was friendly, quick, and knowledgeable as I had several questions about the menu. The Tom yum soup with shrimp is also right out of Bangkok. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Price per dish is $15-20. Come during lunch when it's not very crowded.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Sorry for no photo. Hard to take a quality photo of their excellent khao soi when it's takeout. Speaking of which, it was packaged nicely with the soup and chicken being completely separate from the pickled vegetables, lime, and noodles. The khao soi here is better than the more popular Thai place in the area (Up Thai) with a better mix of spices and better noodles. Chicken fell off the bone but was a bit bland (only complaint.) I tried one other noodle dish a while back which I don't recall which was fine but not as good being a bit too sweet.
No comment

This is my favorite Thai spot in the city! I've literally ran through a tropical storm to eat here before and I have no regrets about it. The food is always so flavorful; you can't really go wrong with whatever you order
Flavorful Thai food with fried rice options (esp. Siamese Fried Rice) that are head and shoulders above the rest. $13 a dish. 5/5 stars as a dinner spot.
No comment

Our new favorite local Thai restaurant.  The outdoor seating is excellent.  The staff are lovely.  You get comped a Thai iced tea or coffee if you review the restaurant.  The food was uniformly awesome. We split an excellent papaya salad to start. My wife swooned over her chicken pad Thai. I loved my Queen of Siam with basil and shrimp.   This restaurant is going to have a place In our rotation.
No comment

The food was served at the perfect temperature and the service was very well timed from the kitchen. Felt like comfort food, but flavorful food. The ambiance was very peaceful and cool. The lighting was just right in the bar and set the mood for a memorable evening.
No comment

One of the best Thai meals. Like everyone in the city, I have my favorites, right next to this one in fact. We are spoiled for choices on the second avenue but I wanted to try this one. So glad I did. Really fun place, wonderful service and amazing food. We shared the vegetable rolls, edamame. green curry with tofu, and ginger vegetables from the wok. The curries and stir fry were so delicious that we ordered extra rice to eat it all up. The vegetable roll was so light, fresh and absolutely delicious. A must add to my local favorites.

This place has beauty AND substance. First of all, super cute outdoor patio. Secondly, the Khao Soi ($18) is amazing! I tried to find something wrong with it. I really did. Flavorful broth with just a little kick, large pieces of moist chicken meat and noodles, and onions and pickled veggies to give it a punch. My only gripe is I left the restaurant with broth splatted across my white tshirt! THEP is a gem in the UES.
No comment
Amazing food! The pad Thai and pork buns were awesome! The chicken satay was perfect for my niece!
No comment

Best thai spot in UES! Clean and great ambiance to dine in. But also has great quality takeout. I work around here and will order often. Ran by real thai people and food definitely tastes like it. Thai iced tea is not watered down and rich in flavor. Must stop by!

Highly recommend this restaurant! Delicious food, super cute vibe and excellent service. The cocktails were as great as they were pretty. The tuna tartare is super fresh and delicious. The crab Rangoon is different from ones I've had but I loved it. I've never described rice as moist but the basil fried rice was just that with the right level of spice. The drunken noodles were also amazing! Can't go wrong here.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food here is delicious! I started with the spring rolls, and the shape and design of each roll was so unique and special! I had the tofu pad thai, and it was fantastic and so flavorful! The tofu is so fresh, and they use unbreaded tofu unlike other restaurants. The noodles were cooked perfectly, and there was a great balance of peanuts, bean sprouts, and green onions.

I got the THEP platter and loved the variety in the assortment. I also enjoyed the chicken pad see ewe with my friend, and it was a pretty large portion. For a party of 2, I think the platter, pad see ewe, and drinks was the perfect amount of food to leave us pleasantly and comfortably satisfied.
No comment
No comment

This place is good!!! Food tasted great and drinks looked really interesting - didn't try one but took a picture of it, shown in this review. Isn't too pricey either. The inside is a bit on the smaller side. But overall great for food quality and drink innovation
No comment

One of my favorite Thai places.  I could eat that pork chop every day. It's so flavorful and juicy.  We enjoyed all the apps as well. You'll want to wear loose clothing because you will leave full.  Also, who wouldn't love a drink in a coconut?

Continues to disappoint. We used to really like the food here. It started deteriorating a while ago but we thought we would try it again because of our good memories. Unfortunately it has not improved. In fact it is gotten worse. The food hardly has any Thai flavor to it and it's really made up of some very bland gravy's with a couple of fresh ingredients thrown in. I would certainly not go back.
No comment
Yum! We ordered basil fried rice, pad kee mao, and the pork chop. All the meat was so tender, and great meat to rice/noodle ratio. Good place to stop for lunch if you're in the UES!

really enjoyed this place- the interior is nice, the food was great. I noticed they actually give a ton of meat in each dish. even my chicken fried rice had a ton of chicken and I noticed my friends plate w beef and pork chop had a TON of meat too. service was also really nice.
No comment
No comment
Super cute for date night. So yummy, I got Tom Kah. I usually get this soup and it was so so yummy here. Definitely recommend!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great food and service with good vibe. It's very authentic Thai food and we will come back for sure!
No comment
No comment
Recommended by friends, for meat eaters, I am very satisfied with their cuisine‍‍Green Curry
No comment
No comment

I have had many excellent meals here. It is one of the best Thai spots in the neighborhood. I also love that they have expanded their outdoor dining to include a patio (currently enclosed during the winter but open air in the summer) and colorful dining huts. My favorite dishes here are the papaya salad, green curry, and pineapple fried rice. My husband loves the lemongrass pork chop and the basil fried rice with duck. You really can't go wrong with anything here. The drinks are also very tasty- both the Thai iced teas and the cocktails. The prices are reasonable, and it has a trendy but also casual vibe. We will continue to come back!

Really delicious food and cocktails! We got many of the apps to split and the highlights were the Kra-Pow puffs and chive pancakes - would highly recommend either or both! The crab Rangoons were pretty typical and the pork buns were okay - a bit too chewy. I got the red curry with chicken and it was so good, however, it lacked the spice I usually prefer. Despite that, the flavors were there and the portion was large enough to split into two meals. Everyone else got an array of entrees (drunken noodles, rice, pad Thai) and enjoyed their choices. We went as a group of 5 on a Friday and they had closed the wait list but we were able to get seated within 30 minutes of arriving. Definitely get there early if you have a larger group! Overall, solid meal with decent prices for the portions. I'd return if I'm in the neighborhood again!
No comment

This restaurant gave me all the feels! The decor was so inviting as my Uber pulled up in front. I couldn't wait to see what this Thai restaurant had in store! I ordered the On Cloud 9 which is a lovely floral Gin drink. There was not a drop left one I finished! For dinner I had the Pad See Eiw, my boyfriend had shrimp pineapple fried rice (We were feeling pescatarian). He said it was the best fried rice he's had since he was in Hawaii. That's saying something! My Pad See Eiw was delicious and fresh. I really enjoyed the way they cooked the shrimp. The super cute decor was the cherry on top. I'll definitely be returning,
No comment
No comment
No comment
Absolutely delicious, paired with stunning decor. At this point, we're pretty we're determined to try everything on the menu. We can't wait to go back!
No comment

This restaurant is quite crowded and we felt quite rushed once we had finished eating to pay the bill and leave. However, the food was exceptional. I had Khao Soi and the broth was very rich with a great depth of flavor. I thought the fried egg noodles added interesting diversity in texture to the dish.
No comment
No comment

Good go to Thai spot! Their food is really sweet so I see why Americans love this spot. Drinks are tasty too. Their fried rice was pretty good! Their Kao Soi had a lot of potential but the noodles were so soggy they were breaking apart. It was just a gross mush. The soup flavor was good though- also sweet. The hostess was a total jerk and refused to seat us at a four person spot even though last call was in twenty minutes and the restaurant was emptying out quickly. No one sat in the four person spot and we instead had to sit by the door looking at this four person spot. The wait staff was really kind though so that was nice. Not sure if we will go back, but it hit the spot and was a cute date night.
Really delicious and well presented Thai food with a lot of great options for vegetarians or people who need GF.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had an exceptional lunch in every way -- great food, great service and relaxing atmosphere! My philosophy? If it's not pretty, why bother! Presentation here is on point, and spice is exactly as described. Only complaint might be how tightly the tables are spaced, but certainly not worth deducting points for. We'll be back!

Phenomenal Thai! Service was amazing and food was unmatched. Loved the dumplings and the pad Thai. I would ask for extra spice if you want it spicy though - it comes very mild. The ambiance is nice for a date or a girls night out. I would recommend a jacket on their heated patios though we wore ours through the dinner.
No comment
The only thing better than the food is the service. Every dish was beautifully plated the flavors complimented each other well. The service was prompt and we were handled with care.

Cute place in the UES!  We had the chicken pad see ew, chicken ginger joy, park mor peanut dumplings, Thai iced tea and the red hot lady tequila cocktail.  Chicken was a bit dry, but both entrees were packed with flavor.  The peanut dumplings were so tasty -- sweet and savory at the same time.  The drinks were not overly sweet.  Good spot for Thai food, would visit again.

Great great food! I loved the crab Rangoon and the summer rolls and the calamari! The Thai tea was also delicious and even better it was free because I left a Google review. All of the plates and cutlery are gold and super unique. The atmosphere on the j side and outside was super chic. Will for sure be back.
No comment

Decided to check this place out upon yelp research! I came to dine in with my friend and ordered calamari, pad see ew and pad kee mao for lunch. Portion is very generous and enough to fill two grown up men. The calamari and shrimp in pad see ew were also very fresh as you can see in the photo attached. I just wished it had little more sauce on it. Will definitely come back again though
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed the food here and it tasted like an authentic Thai cuisine! The noodles tasted very savory and kind of tastes similar to beef chow fun but even tastier. For the clay pot, the pork belly was very tender and delicious. This dish was one of the chefs specials but I was a little disappointed by it because for $30 you only get 3 pieces of pork belly. overall, I would recommend this place if you like Thai food and want to find a good spot.
No comment
Family friendly. Take my two young boys often. They love the pineapple chicken fried rice, which is served in a half-sliced pineapple
No comment

Generous portions, great ambiance, and just really comforting Thai food! The Park Mor was beautiful but even more so delicious with a sweet, tangy peanut filling. The drunken noodle was my favorite; you can adjust the spice to your liking, and the noodles were pleasantly chewy. The restaurant was busy, but the servers made sure we were taken care of, and the bustling atmosphere just made for an even better dining experience. I will definitely be back to try more dishes.

Quaint little restaurant with amazing food. Ventured out last night based on a friend's recommendation. Ordered the thep platter for appetizers and everything in it was amazing, the chives pancakes were much better than I could have anticipated and I typically don't like chives pancakes. For the main meal, I got the Khao Soi Noodle, and wow, did it hit all spots. The sauce was velvety and smooth. The noodle perfect texture and the fried noodles enchanced my palate with its different texture. Will be ordering again without the raw onions, though.
Grabbed lunch here on a rainy day and the food was piping hot and delicious. We ordered the spring rolls and green curry with chicken.
Innovative menu, beautiful interior, fast service. I really enjoyed eating here and would return for a Thai food. Love this place!
No comment

The food was great! We got the THEP platter, Gaeng Phed Ped Yang, and Shrimp pineapple fried rice. The Gaeng Phed Ped Yang had lychee and mango in it, which makes it really good. The platter has a great variety too! The fried rice came in a pineapple, which is really cute! Would recommend this place!

One of my favorite UES spots! The menu is delicious and has plenty of Thai  classics, plus unique dishes of their own. You won't get bored here, and neither will your taste buds. I love the elevated approach to it all as well. And they have great outdoor dining set up for COVID protocols. You get your own private abode, which is really nice! Definitely will come here again... again!
No comment
No comment

We had delicious Thai lunch at this place! My fiancé got the short rib massaman curry and I got the khao soi. The flavors of both curries were great, but the actual meats were just okay. The short rib was not as tender as we had hoped but the chicken thigh in my egg noodle curry was a little better. I recommend getting the khao soi if you're looking for a unique dish - yellow egg noodles in a rich curry broth. Otherwise the service was quick and the place is decorated nicely with partitions between tables. Would recommend for Thai food if you're in the area!
No comment
I like the service. The servers are very kind. I love the fried calamari too! Green goddess is nice too
The food is amazing .. the atmosphere is a vibe. Great lunch spot , dinner , date night .. anything.. let's not forget the free Thai iced teas .. amaze balls

The aesthetics here are so beautiful, the restaurant is draped in flowers and vines , with candles that are lit once the sun begins to set . They have a small yet beautiful bar that prepares many unique cocktails. The food was extremely flavorful and fresh, I was so full but I refused to leave any of my pad Thai on that plate . I can't thank the wonderful staff enough for how much they took care of us, they were even able to seat us on a busy Saturday night after we missed our reservation window . Truly can't wait to be back !
No comment

I started off with the crab rangoon. It was really heavy and creamy as it should be. I could only eat two but it was really good. For my entree, I had the Cashew King. I'm a huge fan of nuts in Asian rice dishes so it definitely hit the spot. It wasn't too busy around lunch time and service was prompt. I had the "Hot Santa" as well. It was a good holiday drink and it was stronger than I thought it would be, but I'm not complaining!

Love the dining aesthetics and authenticity of Thai food at Thep! My friends and I (group of 4) arrived at 6pm and were seated right away on a Thursday evening without waiting at all, but normally, reservations are highly recommended as the dinner rush begins shortly after 6:30pm. You can access the menu via the QR code on the table. There are a lot of options for appetizers, rice, noodle, wok dishes, drinks, etc. We got the pineapple shrimp fried rice, park mor, spicy udon, and a seafood veggie entree with thai iced tea and lychee iced tea. All very flavorful and beautifully plated, and totaling about ~$120 (with tips). In regards to the service, I liked how attentive they were but they did kinda rush us by checking on us numerous times throughout the 2 hrs we were there (ie during ordering, cleaning up dishes, taking our cards for payment). I get that dinner time gets quite busy though... Overall, I would highly recommend Thep and maybe even try during non peak hours for optimal service :)
Food was so delicious! We had steamed shrimp dumplings, pork buns, drunken noodles, and the clay pot. Everything was amazing! The atmosphere and service match too! Highly recommend eating here!
No comment
Wow one of the best Thai food I've had. Cashew Nut is outstanding! Would definitely come back.
No comment
Delicious thank you so much for the food! The drunken noodles were delightful! Great service

I love this restaurant!  The aesthetic is very nice and decorative, while also being elegant.  The drinks are beautiful  Try the cucumber one it tastes so refreshing.  I think the Goddess Garlic stir fry and get it with chicken is so good.  The fried rice is also fabulous, but the basil fried rice is very spicy.  Overall, the food comes out very quickly and the dishes are amazing.  One of my go-to restaurants in the city.
I enjoyed this place! I got the pad kee mao with tofu and it was delicious! Good amount of flavor and spice. I also enjoyed the outdoor seating. Very cute with the decor
No comment
No comment
No comment
We ordered the fried taro ball, drunken noodles with vege duck, branzino, spicy udon with vege duck and Thai fried rice. It was so good!
No comment
No comment

Loved this restaurant!!! First off the decor is BEAUTIFUL! Lovely to sit outside or inside. We were a party of three and got in super fast. The food was delicious. My friend got the massaman Curry and she loved it so much. I got the shrimp Pad thai which was so good I was sad to finish it. This is an amazing Thai spot
Excellent food, great ambience and very accommodative about food restrictions and allergies
No comment
Great food!!! Always ordered take out and today I decided to eat inside the restaurant. Beautiful ambiance and the Thai iced tea is so delicious.
The fresh roll and green curry were delicious - perfect for sharing as well. The iced thai tea was great as well and paired well with our meal!
No comment
No comment

I've been to Thailand and this is by far the best Thai food I've ever had. The Tom yum soup is the best I've ever had and the patio is a fresh take on outdoor seating in NYC. A little pricy with drinks but a must stop by if in the area.
This place is lit. The music is awesome, the overall vibe here is great, the food is very nice! I'd definitely go here again
No comment
Love this place! Best pad thai in the UES. Drinks are on point too!  Pro tip: get the pineapple fried rice (legit comes in a cored out pineapple)! Great presentation and even better taste!
Food is super yummy. I got the massaman curry as it was the only vegetarian dish made without fish. Not tons of non fish veggie options. Service was okay but very pleased with my dish.

The food and ambiance is great at THEp Thai! My brother took me out for my birthday dinner here tonight and I am very happy he did! We ordered the pork belly bun for appetizer and crab fried rice and chicken parang curry for entree. Everything was authentic and delicious

Love this place! Amazing service, great ambiance, and tasty food. This is one of my go-to Thai restaurants when I want to go out and eat dinner with friends. Outside of the amazing food, the decor also feels young, fresh, and modern.
Som was amazing! Super kind and attentive. The panang curry with duck was definitely a bite. Would gladly come back. The thai tea was a great addition too!
Everything was great. Service, food, drinks was cute. Ambience outside is cute, it's a little dry on the inside compared to the outside. I will def come back though and sit on the balcony.
No comment

We are staying upper east side in NYC. We walked by this Thai restaurant and surprisingly it is a cool place. Food portion is fair amount not like other nyc restaurants. If you are in this area then you should give it a try
No comment
No comment

I ordered the THEP Platter which was a smattering of their appetizer menu. It was good overall but the oil might have been a bit old because of the smell when the food came out. I also had the Pork Belly Claypot which was overall good. Less rice and more vegetables would balance the dish more. Presentation was wonderful and service is exceptional.
Hands down - THE BEST THAI FOOD....ANYWHERE! The service is on point. The atmosphere is unmatched. The food, good God, beautifully comforting! Ok literally in LA craving the entire menu! A must try!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Really great food. The restaurant is beautiful so it's nice to sit down. I have also gotten take out that's been easy and food is still good as well.

The food was Delish!! Sooo! Flavorful  nice decor. I'm looking forward to returning to Thep again. There's so many dishes I want to try. I had the short Ribs. The sauce was awesome and the meat fell off the bone. However my strawberry Martini was just ok and it was not very cold. I'm glad I only ordered one and I will not order that again.

Super cute ambiance and good service. Also one of the better designed menus I've seen for a restaurant. Everything is plated really beautifully as well, so you can tell they put a lot of love and pride into their food. Thai ice tea is the right amount of sweet, and I loved the pork belly clay pot. Biggg chucks of jiggly pork, and really fragrant jasmine rice. Definitely coming back next time I'm in the area.

The Thai Iced tea was stellar.  The chive pancakes were cooked perfectly. Siamese fried rice was very well made but the dish that wins is the Pad See Ew (vegan). The date flavor made it one of a kind.
No comment
Great delicious authentic Thai food on the upper East side. The pork belly buns and crabfrued rice were the best I've had! Highly recommend.

Stumbled upon this place around 9 pm on a Monday night. It was one of the only places open at that time, so my friend and I went in for dinner. I ordered an Italian wine and was told they were out, so I ended up with a Cabernet instead. My friend ordered the coffee drink, it was not good at all, not sure why it's even on the menu. Our server was kind enough to swap it out for a glass of wine. The food, overall, was good but not extraordinary. We got the spring rolls, pad Thai with vegetables and pad Thai with duck. The spring rolls were very tasty and I enjoyed the sauce that accompanied them. The pad Thai was not bad but not the best. I prefer Up Thai's pad Thai. The decor inside is beautiful, but the seats are so difficult to get in and out of without knocking things off the table due to the plastic barricades put up in between tables. I understand it's for Covid precautions, but they need to be adjusted to be more comfortable. It also makes it harder to communicate with the servers. We sat inside, but they're outdoor seating looks great.
No comment

Not only is this place aesthetically beautiful, the food is even better! I've had food from here a few times now and it never disappoints. The pineapple fried rice is so delicious and the I can see why the green curry is so popular. It's flavorful but not overpowered by spice. One of my favorite Thai spots in the neighborhood.

Not a good place for us. The food was bland and the nicest thing I could say was that it was passable--like it qualifies as food. The service was non existent. When the bill came we asked to see the receipt and was basically told that we would need to pay in order to see the receipt. Why wouldn't the customer be allowed to see the receipt prior to checking out???? The server rudely told us that she would have to cancel the check and start over. Okay, so? I felt that looking at the receipt was a reasonable request. With a million restaurants in NYC I don't need to come back here.
Wait was short than expected, food was great, interior smaller than I expected. Service was as ok but nothing memorable. Definitely will be back thou.
No comment

Everything was so delicious! So flavorful and high quality. Lovely decor, very friendly service, blasting AC inside, and a super clean bathroom. I was going to say that the prices were expensive, but the portions are pretty huge (so it balances out I guess). Overall, would come again!
No comment

The best thai food we've had in the city thus far. We got the appetizer sampler and the short rib massaman - the curry was perfect and the short rib so tender. The bone pulled right out! The ambience was great for a Saturday lunch in the UES, and the cocktails were fantastic. Will definitely be returning!
No comment
No comment
Enjoyed a great lunch of cashew king chicken.  Service was excellent.  Really enjoyed ourselves.
No comment

Saw the reviews on this place and a friend of mine loves Thai so, we went! Although they don't take reservations, luckily we didn't have to wait at all for a table so that was a plus. Soon as we sat down our waiter was right over ready to assist with any questions we had or if we were ready to order. The drinks, amazing. For apps we had the calamari and the spring rolls. Both would be a 5.5/10. For my main I ordered the fried branzino and felt so bad sending it back. It had zero flavor, not even salt. Just fish and batter. I decided to go with my ole faithful and got the pad see ew and that was a good 6.5/10. Overall, the drinks and the service were great. The food, not so much to me.
No comment
No comment
Super late delivery. Food was in bad shape by the time it arrived. Spent over an hour on the phone trying to get reimbursed. It was a a very bad experience.

We used to live in the area, and Thep Thai is one of our faves! We came back to visit for a week and made sure to come back here. While I miss their lunch specials, the food is still amazing! The pad Thai with vegetables and tofu and Thai iced tea was great.
No comment
No comment
Beautiful interior and exterior. Speedy service and tasty food with stellar presentation. And great covid protection inside and out.
Amazing vibe, amazing service, amazing vibe. This place was amazing. The food was good and came quickly with the drinks
No comment
No comment
No comment
Nice outdoor dining area! Like the foods here. Tasty and yummy authentic Thai food in NYC！
No comment

You can order almost anything off the menu and it's going to be satisfying and delightful. The space is quaint and just lovely to be in. I  wish that service matched the beautiful decor. I felt tense and rushed while I was here
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Love the atmosphere, amazing food and service! The khao soi is authentic and so well made. Love having this place in the neighborhood. Can't wait to come back!

Fantastic authentic Thai restaurant! So glad we found this neighborhood gem! Came on a Saturday afternoon and this place was packed at 4pm! The interior decor is cute. Drinks were cute. We got the curry noddle, and kanom jean nam ngeow (noodle with pork rib and congealed pig pork and yes that's how we know this is authentic). Both were so flavorful and we will absolutely come back here again to try other dishes!!!

Ordered the pad thai and Penang curry. Pad thai was good and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It was a good way to start my NYC vacation. I wished they could make the penang curry more spicy. But overall really good food!

My new favorite Thai restaurant of all time. I've ordered the drunken with tofu/gf and the Tom yum soup to go a few times. The noodles are cooked perfectly, the dish not too saucy. The soup has a little kick to it. I would recommend this to anyone, especially if you're staying in ready to watch a movie.
Awesome vibe and delicious food. Recommend the drunken noodles with shrimp. Peanut dumpling app and egg roll were excellent. Strong drinks and fun times!
No comment
Amazing food and atmosphere. The drinks were delicious. I had the kai soi (pretty sure that's spelled wrong) but will definitely come back when I come back into the city.
Got the lemongrass pork chop, it was juicy and portions were huge. Highly recommend and ask about the free Thai tea!
Very cute interior as soon as you walk in. We sat by the window and we're immediately amazed by the decor. Also, it's heated inside which is nice with the chilly weather.
We chose Thep because it's conveniently located at 75th and 2nd on the Upper East Side. Tom Yum soup was delicious . I have never seen or tasted anything like the Park Mor .
No comment

We had the appetizer platter to start then the GAENG PHED PED YANG and the PLA RAD PRIK. The gaeng phed ped yang was spicy and flavorful. The pla rad prik (branzino) was my dish and I ate every bite. I wish we could have tried more!! The staff all worked together and nothing was overlooked. I was really impressed with how well they did considering that there was no empty tables.
Two of us had a delicious lunch here. Ample portions of good quality food. Lovely outside space. Will for sure return, and probably put Thep on my local delivery list.
I really liked this place, it was our first time coming and I will be coming back. The food was great and it was serve in a timely manner we didn't have to wait long. The service was great
Everything was superb! Incredible service and presentation. Flavors were robust and perfectly balanced! 10/10 highly recommended!

My go-to order at Thai restaurants is usually the khao soi, and I can easily say that this khao soi is one of the best I've ever had. The dish itself was so flavorful, and the chicken on the bone (which I highly recommend) was very juicy! We also ordered the park mor as an appetizer, which was presented beautifully and packed with an intense peanut flavor. Yum! The drinks we ordered (lychee thai tea, thai iced coffee, and Coffee or Me cocktail) were also delicious, but not too sweet at the same time. Wonderful service all around - would definitely dine here again!
Beautiful decorations, great food, and great service! All sorts of food, avocado curry is the special and you cannot miss thep wings!
Nice foods great service and very decorated restaurant. Highly recommend to visit. Next spot in upper east side

Amazing staff and food were amazing! What we ordered in the picture is the "Golden Sachet". These were a bundle full of joy with crab meat/minced chicken, egg, and vermicelli. The sauce complemented the fried appetizer and it came with a sweet sauce wasn't too over powering. Would definitely recommend this place!
No comment

Ploy was our server, she was great and very helpful in ordering.  Our favorite thing is that we can big our old man Ryu. He loves Thai food too. Food was fantastic and Ryu approved. Definitely coming back.

Can I first say how beautiful the digital menu is?! My family and I are staying down the street from this restaurant and decided to order in. The online ordering process was simple and the delivery was efficient. Between the three of us we had the red curry vegetarian, the cashew king beef, spring rolls, and the pineapple fried rice with shrimp. We loved every bite! It was one of those dinners where no one spoke much because we were so into our food. I did order the Tom kha pumpkin soup and I didn't like it. However, I'm a picky eater and it had to do with preference rather than quality. Despite the soup, I'd love to order in from here one more time before I leave NYC!
Fast Service and great customer service! Food is delicious and reasonable priced. I came with a big group and we were seated in a separate space and it felt very safe.
No comment
No comment
Came here for lunch and enjoyed it! We got the paid Thai and spicy udon - highly recommend!
No comment

Great thai spot on the UES. We got thai tea & coffee and both were excellent as well as the chicken pad thai and avocado massaman curry. The noodles & curry were both pretty good. Would definitely come again if I'm in the area.
No comment

Walked in the THEP for lunch and was super pleasantly surprised. The decor was cute and aesthetically pleasing, the wait staff were attentive and friendly. But most importantly, the food was INCREDIBLE. They have so many vegetarian and vegan options, I wish I could have tried everything on the menu! I ordered the Pom & Bubble cocktail, Tom Kha with tofu, and the Cashew King with tofu. Highly recommend, 5/5 on every aspect.

Food was flavorful and do not misunderstand medium for it spicy because if you ask for spicy it's F********* SPICY. Service could've been less rushed, we sat down for barely a minute and we're asked what we wanted to drink when we haven't even gotten the chance to scan through the menu. Then when they came back to ask if we were ready to order food it was barely 2 mins after that then another 2 min and another 5 mins. While we were eating they reached over us to pick up our garbage, which was just the straw wrapper. Also while two other people in my party were finished with their dishes I was not and they were quick to clean up the table and took away my spoon & plate. They should relax a little and clean up after the entire table is finished.
I had pad Thai. We sat outside in the wooden houses and the heater didn't keep it as warm as I'd like. I enjoyed the Thai tea.
Love this place have been here a handful of times, food and drinks are ways delicious

Great place, great service, definitely worth the visit.  It was 2 of us, but we ate for 4, lol.  The food came out amazingly quick and cooked perfectly.  We had 3 appetizers, salad and 3 entrees.  Would definitely go back when I am in the area.
Great, authentic food and large portions! The interior of the restaurant is also fancy.
No comment
The food is fresh, hot, and tasty! What more could you ask for. The ambiance is also very lively and a fun place to eat
No comment

Came here on a Monday although it was a holiday. One thing to know they open at 5pm for lunch. They have outdoor and indoor seats. Indoor is very cute as you get your own private little house with air conditioners. The service is fast and friendly. We started with appetizers the Thep platter and fresh rolls and wow very yummy! It gets even better they have happy hour and their lychee martinis are so refreshing and prices are very reasonable. The food and entrees we were also very happy with. I had shrimp pineapple fried rice and my sister a pad Thai my dad had the chicken friend rice and we all enjoyed our food we will definitely be back.
We got the khao soi, peanut dumplings, Kalamari, tea leaves salad - it was all so good and the dishes were creatively made!
No comment
No comment

This is a lovely, upscale but fairly priced Thai restaurant. We had a tasty lunch. Not her sweet potato Pad Thai is made from finely cut sweet potato and not sweet potato flour. The Pad Thai was a bit too sweet but was flavorful.
Great food and drinks. We would def come back! We had massaman curry and vegetable spring rolls.
No comment
Delish food and a lovely contemporary setting. It was busy, but our waitress handled it well.
No comment
I am on an errand in nyc and of course it is time for good food as well! Thai food here is well presented and taste good! Much better than the $15 pad Thai in New Jersey town.

The Pad Thai was delicious!!! My sister-in-law had ordered it for me from California.. it arrived at my apartment at the time given! AND it was hot AND It was delicious AND it was a healthy Serving!!!

Pre-hurricane take out experience-- had high expectations given the number of great reviews, however there wasn't a standout dish from our order. To be fair, we did order the standard curry, basil fried rice, and pad thai, and we did not dine in. I recommend this as a safe option when the craving for Thai food hits.

When you are a great cook it's hard to have a favorite:) you know what I mean.  It's not just The best Thai food in my neighborhood it's the best in NYC. Our server, his name is UP is so knowledgeable and had great service as always. Try THEP Thai never go anywhere else. lovely employees
Love the ambiance, food, and interesting cocktail menu. Great date spot or fun hangout!
Love the decor and atmosphere plus the food was delicious! I got the khao soi and it was top quality. And great customer service as well. Excellent overall. One of my new fav spots

Will 100% come again to try some more Thai staples, felt like I didn't order the best of what this place had to offer. Got the KANOM JEAN NAM NGEOW. The pork blood isn't my favorite but the noodles are very tender. The broth has just the right amount of fatty and flavor. Meanwhile I liked the Khao Soi was much better. Super coconuty with a hint of refreshing sourness.

Stopped in here on a busy night solo and sat at the bar. The food is delicious and staff is attentive. This restaurant has a really cool vibe and is a great spot to grab delicious Thai food on the UES!
No comment
Bf and I went here for dinner a date night on a Saturday ~8pm and we were seated immediately in the heated patio. Definitely get the peanut dumplings! They're so yummy.
Horrible. They basically rushed us out and were very rude. Felt very uncomfortable because the workers hovered over us.
No comment

column3: Aerospace Industrial Park, Daytona Beach, FL
column6: Absolutely delicious and super quick service! I got there at 4:11 on a Saturday and was sat right away! We finished our meal before 5pm! We started off with the Red Hot Lady as our drink and spring rolls and wonton soup as apps! Besides the drink being beautiful, it was super strong 10/10. We then ordered the spicy udon, shrimp pineapple fried rice, and Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodles). Everything was so flavorful and beautifully plated. The udons were my favorite tho!! Nice spice :)
The BEST Thai food I've had ever. Glad I added this to my bday stop. I can't wait to visit again!
Good for for the value. A bit crowded but makes sense the food this the spot. Will definitely go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Always a drunken noodles that's what it's about with tofu and a side of jalapeño vinaigrettes Mas
Excellent and inventive Thai food! Probably the best on the UES. Bua and upthai are right nearby but THEP is for sure the superior choice!

A coworker recommended this restaurant so I decided to give it a try for dinner at work. I got the red curry and found it pretty similar to Up Thai's. Maybe my spice tolerance is getting better because I found it to be even less spicy than Up Thai's red curry even though Thep is supposedly more authentic? Dunno but I would like to try their other menu items (pad kee mao, etc.) before coming to a verdict. Delivery was quick and my food arrived much faster than anticipated but I am only a few blocks away lol.
No comment

Yummy. Yummy. Yummy. I love the food at THEP. The food is better in the restaurant than we ordered out. I suggest eating at the restaurant. We ordered: crab Rangoon, pad Thai, crab rice, drunken noodle. It was all delicious.
No comment

I came here for a friends birthday and they accommodated us well when we got there because there were more of us than expected. The only reason i give it any stars was because the food was really good. One of our friends was obviously intoxicated and ordered 5 shots. We all said no to the shots and told the waitress no. She heard us and laughed. She still brings the shots. When we tell her we don't want them, she says we can't take them back. We told them we wanted to take the drinks back multiple times and they wouldn't let us. We were pretty upset about that but gave two of them to the birthday girl and two to the girl who ordered them and one was left. Literally none of us wanted shots. They came back with the bill and charged us for drinks we said not to bring. After going back and forth with them, we just had the girl who ordered them pay for the drinks ($80). I talked to the waitress and told her it was very inconsiderate of her and she didn't have much to say. So that Was pretty rude on their part. Don't think I'd be going back due to the customer service.

You get a full effect of the 5 senses in this place - amazing food taste quality- great ambiance and plenty of menu options- highly recommend this place.  We had pad Thai. Pineapple shrimp fried rice , basil fried rice , spring rolls and

The food is flavorful and fresh, and this would definitely be a four-star restaurant. I removed a star because the portions are disappointing. The Panama curry came in a large bowl or broth. We ordered chicken and shrimp for a 5-dollar up charge. There were two shrimp. Two, that's absolutely ridiculous. The drunken noodles were tasty, and the pork bun was, unfortunately, just ok.

I had the pad kee moo aka drunken noodles with shrimp, crispy shrimp rolls, tom yum soup and it all was delicious, unfortunately i cant give an overall rating. Only cause i ordered takeout have not dined in yet and if it helps any the delivery was super fast and like i stated the dish was delicious. Give them a shot!
