THEP is an amazing new Thai place that just opened up on the upper east side. Their service is the best I've seen in the neighborhood so far. They are attentive and have enough staff to tend to their customers. The food was tasty and had great presentation as well. THEP actually uses Thai spices in their food to give the authentic experience. Beware if you are not capable of eating spicy foods! Their lunch menu is a great value with an appetizer, soup/salad, and an entree for ~$12. Overall worth it and will come back for future lunches with my team.
Great Thai food spot with good variety. Try the chicken dumplings and the appetizer platter. You won't be disappointed. Spicy noodles FTW.

This restaurant is one of my go-to's! It's soups, noodle and curry dishes are all dependable. The service is excellent and so friendly. They also have frequent specials and lunch deals. Take advantage! They deliver as well! YUMMMY!

This place is so good. Service is outstanding. Food is beyond delicious. We had the lemongrass pork chop, shrimp pad Thai, and green curry with chicken. Everything was better than the standard Thai food you usually get. Recommend!

This place was introduced by my friend. The food was the delicious especially the calamari. Som was our host and she was very patient with us. She made sure that everything was smooth with our orders. Will definitely come back!
Som was great and efficient. Food was delicious as always. Good covid safety practices with great outdoor private seating areas, heat lamps and hand sanitizers. It's a neighborhood staple
No comment
Amazing authentic Thai, can't beat the lunch special prices either. Best pad Thai in NYC

Went here with my girlfriend on a busy Saturday night. The place was packed, but the wait wasn't long at all thanks to quick and efficient service. The atmosphere was really nice both inside and outside the restaurant. Most importantly, the food and drink was amazing quality for decent prices. Definitely the best Thai food I've had in manhattan. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick and delicious meal. I hope to come back soon.
Got the Penang curry - it was very good! Also recommend the crab balls. Would come back
Enjoyed the setup for covid it felt very private. Massaman curry had a nice kick to it
Great out door set up with separate cubbies! Very nice presentation and enjoyed the food
eating on Monday, first day of phase 2, excellent ambience, classy service, excellent food and drinks. One of upper east side finest dining stops. Must visit!
The panang curry is great! The outdoor seating is spacious and there was no wait for a table.
Great lunch specials! Lots of vegetarian and vegan options, and amazing service. Pad kee mao with veggies and tofu was delicious. Will be back!
No comment

The food here is delicious, the ambiance is wonderful and the drinks are wonderful too. Their Thai iced tea was actually legendary. I highly recommend this place if you want authentic food and good vibes.
No comment

Really liked this place! You can go dressed up or a little more casual, either way you will feel comfortable. Everything we had was good! I especially loved the sampler platter appetizers. And getting the pineapple fried rice is a MUST! It's served in a pineapple! Yum!!

Chill vibe, amazing furniture & light fixtures! Have to make a reservation because this place is always busy. The food is really good and service is quick. Pad Thai is a best seller and one of the best dishes. 10/10!

Consistently the best Thai food in NYC. Pad Thai + drunken noodles + shrimp steamed dumplings has been my go-to order for last 2 years. Also happy hour 5-6pm with great drinks. Amazing service and COVID friendly outdoor seating. Would highly recommend to every NYC patron.
Great Thai. Very authentic. Waitstaff is fantastic and make sure you have a good experience. The drinks are also surprisingly good!

Went here a while back but I still think about the spicy udon noodles and pad kee mao. SO GOOD. Thai food is usually vegetarian friendly, but the vegetarian duck creates so many more options. Thai coffee was new to my palate and I can safely say I'm a fan. Would definitely recommend.
Easily the best thai on the UES! The food is wonderful, the ambiance is fantastic. Take your date or take your family!

I live in this area and I've try many different Thai restaurants.This place is definitely my favorite one. I love to eat there, the decor is very nice for a thai spot. I recently found out about their new menu. I tried the thep rice bowl and its probably my new favorite dish.

New favorite Thai restaurant! I got the pineapple fried rice and it was jam packed with favor! Staff was super friendly as well. Great place for a date, my girlfriend loved the place. Oh, don't forget to get the Thai iced tea!

Best Thai restaurant ever! Taste & service & cleanliness & interior design etc everything was perfect! I personally recommend basil fried rice. We ordered two because we couldn't stop eating it. I will come here again for sure!
The best Thai restaurant in the area. Ordered crab rangoon, pad see ew, and pineapple fried rice. All were excellent. Staff exceptionally friendly. Highly recommend.

Came to this place for Saturday lunch and there were plenty of tables available. Cozy with a modern vibe. The service I got was fast and friendly. I got a Thai iced tea for a review and also ordered Pad Kee Mao, spicy udon, and chicken satay. The chicken was moist and flavorful. The noodle dishes were decent, but missing the high-heat wok flavor that is quintessential to Asian stir fried dishes.
No comment
One of my favorite Thai restaurant in Manhattan! Great ambiance and food was excellent

Very cute experience! The little pods are perfect for a fun safe dinner with friends. There was a bit of a wait but it was Friday night so expected. The food was delicious and the drinks were great. Pricing pretty average for nyc. The staff were all super friendly and quick.
No comment

In my one week trip in NY, this was definitely one of my favorite places to eat. The ambiance was incredibly well done and the food hit all the right notes. Definitely the standout was the Pad Thai w/Vegetarian Duck as well as the Tea Leaves Salad. Overall, highly recommended and would definitely come here again on a future trip!

Really great place for the price. I got the chicken koh soi and it was really good. I like that it wasn't too spicy and still flavorful. The hostess with the bob haircut was also really bubbly and came to check up on us. The place is a little tight but there's a good amount of seating and a bar Incase. They have a ton of choices and take out as well.

This place has great good and service was very attentive. Highly recommend the pannang cury and pad Thai. Their selection of cocktails is also very elaborate and diverse! We came on a Sunday night around 7:30 and didn't have to wait for very long.

Had the Khao Soi! Perfect dish for those who want noodles but with curry. So delicious and creamy with a hint of spiciness. The fried egg noodle on top really balanced out the overall chewy consistency of the dish. Loved the red onion garnish as well. The chicken was also super tender. Nice big portion to fill me up too! Beautiful place and nice service.
The Chicken Pad Thai was good and the place looks really nice. It has a chill atmosphere.
Great service, food and ambiance, would recommend! Got the Chicken PadThai for dinner and it was delicious. Friends got a variety of entree dishes and looked just as appetizing.
The staff is very professional. Excellent choice of food. The duck I had was amazing!
It was an ok experience. The drunken noodle is not that good. The noodles is too starchy. I can only taste the heat of the chili. I think the only thing my family enjoyed was the Thai tea.
No comment
Just had dinner here and it was amazing! You get all the traditional Thai dishes I love. Their drunken noodle with seafood and papaya said were my favorites! So good, definitely coming back

The food was amazing. Me and my friend came in around 5pm for dinner after exploring the MET. It wasn't too packed and we were seated instantly. Everything from the deco to the utensils were beautiful. We ordered the Avocado Massaman Curry, fried pineapple rice, and lychee tea. Both plates were delicious. The presentation of the food was also gorgeous. Id give this restaurant 5 stars if it wasn't for the below average service. I will definitely return soon.
Great Beef Drunken Noodle. Their lunch special brings so much food. The spring rolls or Gyoza are delicious. For the UES, this is a great deal. I only order Thai food in this area from them.
No comment

Went here during lunch. Ordered the basil fried rice and it was amazing! It also came with a starter and either soup or salad since it was a lunch special. Will definitely come back here again to try the avocado masaman curry. Sorry I had to finish the soup while it's hot lol.

I ordered chicken Red curry and it was super good but very spicy. It came in the coolest little cauldron which made it fun to eat! The atmosphere is very nice and modern, i have gone here 3 or so times craving the curry!
No comment
No comment
This corner restaurant goes on my list as an upper east hot spot ! Great vibe, food and drink! Plus a check in for Thai iced tea !

Loved the outdoor spacing they had with the new Covid regulations. Felt super comfortable outside in our own little area. Drinks were super classy and presentable. And we also had the coconut ice cream which came in an actual coconut. Loved the area and the ambiance. Would come again!

We were seated promptly on a Saturday evening and ordered the Khao Soi with yellow curry. The food came out quickly and our server was very attentive. We enjoyed both dishes and the portion was quite generous. The Thai ice tea was also very good. Would definitely come back again!

Delicious curry and pad Thai. Came here on a rainy day for lunch and got the red curry with chicken.. friend got the pad Thai with tofu. We split and shared and also got the Thai iced tea. Everything was cozy and delicious and I'll definitely be back!

Service was wonderful from the second we entered the door. We were seated quickly after using the waitlist feature (no wait!). The restaurant smells amazing and it's so hard to choose an entree because everything looks extraordinary. I finally settled on Kanom Jean Nam Ngeow, a noodle soup dish I've never tried while traveling in Thailand. I was pleased to see they offered Khao Soi though (a go-to dish in a Chiang Mai). The pork buns were out of this world! Also love the free Thai Tea Yelp offer.
Found this neighborhood gem while looking for a last minute dinner. Seating was super quick, staff was attentive, food was delicious and authentic. Great meal after a day putting together furniture.

Fantastic Thai spot. The best that I have had in NYC hands down. The staff was super friendly and first rate. Loud and vibrant atmosphere. Great happy hour specials before 6PM. Will definitely be back!!

I'm surprised that this restaurant has such high ratings. I came for dinner during the week and shared the sampler platter appetizer and pad see ew with duck to share. The platter was good, everything was deep fried. Pad see ew was just ok, not as much flavor as I was hoping for. The duck was cooked well though. Prices are standard for the neighborhood. I prefer Up Thai over this place.

I love this Thai restaurant. Best lunch special the food is flavorful and I l or the lychee Thai iced tea. Their pineapple fried rice is to die for presentation is everything. I also always get their Tom yum soup when I'm sick so good !!
Amazing food. Great drinks. The hostess was also amazing and took the time to make recommendations to us.
This is a very nice, well decorated restaurant with good food and ambiance. I recommend to anyone in the area.
No comment

As soon as I walked in, I was comforted by the festive and quiet ambience. I ordered the Kanom Jean Nam Ngeow since it is not something I usually see on menus and it was just the thing I needed on a cold day. The portion is very substantial with plenty of meat included. The service  was also great and seamless.
No comment

This is now my new favorite Thai place in the city. Picked this place on a whim on my way home. It was quite busy but we were seated promptly. We were a party of 3 with 2 of us being vegan but the menu was quite accommodating to both. We opted for the veggie pancakes and spring rolls for starters, both were delicious. The veggie pancakes were so good we had to get another order. For our entrees we had the basil fried rice and vegetarian duck which was so unbelievably tasty. For not being real duck I really couldn't tell. Very flavorful. They were out of desserts that evening but we'll go back to try them and for more duck.

Amazing food - we had the appetizer plate with spring rolls and dumplings.  It had 4 different sauces and all were delicious.  Perfectly balanced green papaya salad and Queen of Siam chicken basil was outstanding. 4 stars because the service is a bit inattentive.  Although the restaurant is at 25% capacity it took a half an hour for them to acknowledge us and take our order. We shared a half bottle of sake.  They only had cold sake.  Decor is ok and they have both indoor and outdoor seating.

This is a good place to come to hang out with friends. Nice environment. The dishes are good and very fresh and yummy. The service is wonderful. This is the first time I came here and will come again. The salad are fresh. All dishes I chose are delicious. Recommend!
Overall decent place.  I loved the interior!  Not all the dishes I tried were good but about half of them were pretty darn good!
This is my favorite pattaya place. Nice service and green place. Definitely I'll come back
No comment

This is an authentic Thai cuisine located in upper east side, great ambience and excellent service. I love the chicken satay and chive pancakes. Their papaya salad is the highlight of the night, crunchy, and fresh!!!!
amazing food and atmosphere all the appetizers were A one! So delicious must try, the chicken on a stick was so good and pineapple fried rice was delicious
Very COVID friendly and the food was absolutely delicious! The fried shrimp dumplings are a MUST!
Great scenery one of the best indoor/outdoor dinning experience and the appetizers were amazing
No comment

Wow. My favorite Thai restaurant in the city. The food is outstanding. Only taking off a star because the service is spotty. When we ordered something to drink here last time my server completely forgot to bring two of three drinks out (she only remembered the one alcoholic drink) and then left it on the bill. I had to ask her to take them off and she just seemed super frazzled about everything. Another time I ate here they brought out the wrong dish. Despite these service problems I continue to eat here because the food is so good! This place is super busy on weekends, much easier to get a table on weeknights.
No comment

Went to this place because they have individual and heated pods during this pandemic.  Kudos to Thep for providing such effort in decorating the pods to make it comfortable for the customers.  Thank you.  I just wish you made the same effort with your food.  Although food is presented with creativity, the quality wasn't that good.

Beautiful place, amazing food and lovely staff. Went to Thailand last month and really missed eating the food so this place took me back, especially with the Chang beer:)...Everything was delicious! Kapkun!!

Haven't gotten our food yet but I really liked the outdoor dining wooden tents with heated lamps inside. Their customer service is great and I appreciate their fast accommodations with outdoor dining using a push button to call our server. Our server Pat was very sweet and helpful with the process.
Amazing atmosphere, authentic food, and excellent service! Our server Som was so attentive and accommodating to our diet restrictions! Very happy will definitely be back!

Nice corner location can't miss it. Nice crowd at 3pm  on a Thursday.  We got here in time to enjoy lunch specials. Ginger dressing on their house salad was amazing.  My daughter who considers herself an expert taste tester for pad Thai says the chicken pad Thai was one of the best she's tasted.  I had the green curry with Tofu, it was delicious!  I would go back here. There's a reason why they have great ratings.

A cute restaurant on the UES, this place has excellent decor and fantastic service. My girlfriend and I shared the Crispy Duck Salad and the Khao Soi, both of which were fresh and delicious, though arguably a little sweeter than what our palettes would have liked. There were a fair few other items on the menu that we would have liked to have a nibble of, so we will make sure to be back soon if we are back in the area.
This is my second time here, and the service and food is impeccable. Shout out to the waitress Pond who was very accommodating with seating as well.

What a great dining experience! Thep has done an amazing job creating a pleasant, warm and delicious outdoor dining environment. The seating areas were very private and cozy and the service was impeccable. We ordered the chive pancake, crab Rangoon and basil fried rice - all of which were perfection! 10/10 would recommend
No comment

The traditional Northern Thai food was amazing! We were seating in a warm outdoor booth. There was at least 2 hour wait for a table on a Saturday night. Perry, our waitress, was super nice and checked on us multiple times during our meal.

This is SUCH GOOD Thai food. Highly recommend the spring rolls to start. Loved loved loved the pad Thai. Also if they have it definitely get the crab fried rice. Comes in a coconut which is cool. service is good. Overall great experience.
No comment
Pad Thai is ok . I had better in other upper east side restaurant. Curry noodle soup better.
Great outdoor dining area and ambience! There is a heater that keeps people warm. Ordered pineapple rice and coconut soup.
The food overall was delicious! The customer service was great, get the Thai ice tea and basil fried rice ! 100% recommended.

Found this spot coincidentally while looking for a good hearty spot to eat on the UES. Ambiance is beautiful and matches the gorgeous food presentation. Service is also super friendly and makes you feel right at home right away. The sweet potato pad Thai caught my eye so that was the obvious choice and it didn't disappoint. Will be coming back!
SOOOO GOOOOOOOOOOOD! Upper East Side is so blessed to have this place. I cant tell you how much I love this place
Restaurant ambience is cozy. Our waitress is super friendly and helpful. They take covid precautions in this place.

Great local spot for Thai fix. Thai ice tea is actually very tasty (not water down) and not overly sweet. We came here for lunch special and the entree is decent generous portion. Definitely will come back again!
No comment
Excellent spot!  Really enjoyed the food and great service.  I was with a group and we tried a variety of dishes that included buns, curry, pad Thai...I highly recommend.
Super nice staff here! The ambiance is super modern, chic and chill. Would def come back here and solid three course lunch special for less than $13! I came during the weekday so it wasn't busy.
No comment
We got the pineapple rice thai and the khao soi. They were really good, with a lot of shrimps and chicken. Their outdoor seatings are nice and service is friendly. I recommend.
The food here is delicious and a bit different than other Thai restaurants. The outside seating is great in the summer a d the cocktails are delicious.
Food is not bad but a bit over priced. The puff was pretty good very crispy. Summer roll is a pretty big one although I would prefer some protein it.

This place is a great spot on the upper east side ! The ambiance is relaxing with dim lighting and flowers hanging from the ceiling . But the food is the real reason to come here. The green curry is delicious!
Amazing calamari, would come here just for that. Fair priced entrees that taste just as amazing. Would definitely come back

I loved the outdoor seating seating arrangement. Having walls in between tables made the space feel extra space. The staff were attentive and came by frequently to check if we needed anything despit having a system to call them when we needed. Food was also delicious

This spot had the perfect little private outdoor booths with great heating and ambiance. Nam was our server and she was fantastic! Definitely recommend this place. I got the spicy udon and it was great!

This place is amazing! Very good food. Get the khao soi or drunken noodles.  The Thai iced tea is also very good. Overall a very good place. The inside is also very well decorated. Food comes out quickly
Great Thai place on the upper east. Good food and great service. Try the sampler platter
This place is awesome, This place is really great. The service is amazing, and they have great things put in place for the weather and Covid conditions

Me and my friends we come to New York every so often and we always try a new Thai restaurant. THEP was everything I wanted and more! With one of the best lunch specials in the business and great high quality food, it makes this one of the best Thai restaurants I've visited!
This place is not just a cheap thai place!!! It's very authentic and very reasonable price. Love their food so much!!

I love the ambiance in this trendy east side restaurant. My wife and I came here on a Saturday night at around 8pm and were immediately seated ( a surprise, given how packed it initially appeared). We ordered the Tom yum soup, Khao soi, and the pork belly. The Tom yum soup was flavorful despite its light consistency. My Pork Belly was generally pretty good, but could have benefited from slightly less dry meat. Overall, I recommend this place, and would come back to try the other offerings in the menu.

I've generally enjoyed their food -- tasty with interesting gentle spices -- but today I'm left with one question: where was the pineapple in their Pineapple Fried Rice?  I ordered mine with chicken, and there was enough chicken, but I probably found only one or two tiny pieces of pineapple in the entire container (takeout).  Other than that, the people who work there always seem friendly, and the dine-in atmosphere is casual yet date-worthy -- so next time I guess I'll just specify to please make sure to include the pineapple!
Tasty Thai food! Ordered avocado massman curry and seasonal special pork chop clay pot. The curry is ok but the clay pot is really good. :)
Chill vibes, chive pancakes, Tom kha soup are great apps and fried branzino is also good
this place is amazing! I ordered the chicken pad thai and the serving size is worth the piece

Really great vibe excellent menu options -- I should have gone with something other than the chicken pad Thai since it was really salty but that might have been since the chef just added too much salt to mine ‍

I went out of my way to come here cause I saw the great reviews, and voila.....it was amazing. The staff is very attentive, the atmosphere is perfect, and the food was amazing. I can't wait to try the other items o the menu.

The service was excellent! I was very pleased that they were able to accommodate our large group in short notice. I've been here for lunch many times and have been satisfied with the taste, quality and quantity.
This is literally some of the best food i've ever tasted in my entire life. Across food genres. Beautiful aesthetically pleasing dishes, drinks, and decor. 10/10 would recommend.

My husband and I were looking for a place to eat after walking all afternoon at the MET. I needed something hearty because we hadn't had anything to eat all day. I looked on Yelp and saw THEP Thai. Saw the reviews and decided to try it. Thank goodness we did. The food was absolutely amazing. My husband said nothing the entire time that we were there because he was too busy concentrating on his food. The lemongrass pork chops were amazing and OMG the pad thai. My husband said that this is the best he's ever had. I absolutely concur. I highly recommend trying THEP Thai. You will be hooked.
Great food and great service! Pond was an excellent server. Highly recommend if you're in the UES. They also deliver!
My favorite Thai restaurants in UES. They serve the best pad Thai and Tom yum soup!  The staff are very friendly as well. I highly recommend it!
Great place, good vibe, delicious Thai food and good service. I like the Thai tea and the Tom yum soup. The pork belly is ok.
THEP has a great outdoor set up which really blocks the wind and keeps you warm! Highly recommend the Thai iced tea, the chive dumplings, and the spicy udon noodles!
Great authentic Thai food... Siamese fried rice was amazing! So tasty! Duck was crispy yet flavorful! Totally recommend!
Amazing food, super tasty and beautiful plating! The food was delicious and in a prime location as well!
Such a fantastic spot! They have an AMAZING outdoor dining setup (with heating) and the food is truly some of the best Thai I've ever had in the city! 10 out of 10!
Very tasty lunch. Friendly service! The drunken noodles hits a spot you didn't know you have.

Service was great! Food was really really good. Get the ginger salad the ginger dressing is amazing. Great amount of food for the lunch portion for a really good price. The atmosphere of the restaurant is also super cute.
A vegetarian, a vegan and a carnivore walked into a Thai place on the Upper East Side of NYC and found flavorful dishes for everyone. Good service and very reasonably priced!
This place has nice ambiance and the food is amazing! Love the Pad Thai. Great for a group dinner.
No comment
No comment
The restaurant is really good. We ordered lunch specials, including 1 starter, 1 salad or soup, 1 featured or attraction, which are really delicious. Definitely recommend the restaurant.
This place was so cute inside and outside and the food was amazing. Curry, pad Thai, and drunken noodle dishes were all delicious and they had really good and pretty cocktails as well!!

column3: Radnor - Fort Myer Heights, Arlington, VA
column6: Elegant place to go. Thai Sausage Fried Rice and Basil Fried Rice are so good! The best Thai restaurant I've ever been in NYC. Highly recommended to all foodies.

The food was amazing with great prices. Nice music playing that makes it so you can still talk. Really nice lighting and ambiance. Seems there are many precautions as well to prevent covid, with indoor and outdoor seating options
The best meal, very well seasoned and truly authentic Thai taste. Say that 3 times fast.

Fast service, delicious food, good ambience, lovely presentation. They have indoor and outdoor dining. Had the red curry and house salad, both of which were excellent. Didn't get any cocktails but they looked really pretty.

The restaurant offers a slightly different menu with some excellent old favorites like Massaman Curry with Beef.  The volcano chicken( actually Cornish game hen) was very very tasty and a nice departure from your typical Thai menu. All in all a very pleasant dining experience. If you come for the food you won't be disappointed!!!!!

I've been wanting to try this new spot, so I just ordered a chicken pad Thai and it was ready in about 10-15 minutes. The portion and price were both great and it tastes soo good! The guy on the phone was so nice and when I went to pick up the food multiple employees were also kind and asked if I was taken care of. I'll definitely be back!

Amazing Thai place! Best green curry I've had, and papaya salad is yummy too. Pad Thai and drunken noodles are great and not sticky or heavy. Reasonably priced and wait staff is super nice and attentive - I go here whenever I'm in the area. Plus it's pretty and the silverware is beautiful! Love it

My friend and I ordered drunken noodles and pineapple fried rice. It's really good & HUGE TIP: they give you a free ice Thai tea if you write a review LOL so it could be a sponsored post but my review is honest I swear hahah

It was surprising to find a good tasting Thai place around this part of NY. I had been to a lot of Thai place before and I have to say this place definitely doesn't disappoint. I ordered the typical Thai dishes like pad thai, thai basil drunken noodle, thai green curry, sweet chili fish, and pineapple fried rice. All the dish tasted good, and really flavorful. Usually most bad Thai place is all sweet and not spicy, but this place tasted most authentic I had in a while. Definitely recommended place to go to if you are in the area.
The food was amazing and the service was great. I would definitely come back. I ordered the green curry and it was so delicious

Loved the ambience and the character of the place. We ordered pad kee-mao and garlic goddess with veggies. Both of them had a very unique taste. And on the top of it, also got Thai iced tea for free! Would definitely recommend!
Great ambience and service. Pad kee mao is a must have! One of the best Thai places on the upper east side!

We came here based on  other good reviews and they did not disappoint! Everything was wonderful and came out promptly. The service was also great. We ordered the golden sachels and pad Thai which was amazing! We will come back!

This is a wonderful Thai place. It has amazing food. The quality of food is affordable for the price. Great for a causal date night. Order the pad Thai and mass man curt. The Thai tea is excellent too. The servers were prompt, would def come back here several times.

It was ok overall. Food was not very flavorful and almost everything we got was a bit bland but not unbearable. If you like spice in your Thai food, this is not the place for you. Service was not great, I got charged twice for an order and had figure it out with my bank.

Beautiful decor and great food! The lunch special is fantastic. We got Pas See Ew for $12 with a salad and spring rolls that were delicious. The restaurant has very great food and a great feel! There needs to be a THEP Thai in my home town.
Tasty vegan option indeed. Not the healthiest options but who goes out to eat for healthy options? XD Their drunken noodles is my favorite!
Nice atmosphere and music. The lighting and aesthetic is calming. Really great lunch special. The staff is really friendly and the food is always delicious. Love the Thai iced tea and red curry.
Had lunch with coworkers and friends. Delicious food and atmosphere, a short time getaway from the office.

Really good Thai restaurant at UES. Would highly recommend the drunken noodles, the toasted basil on top is really good. They also have some more authentic Thai dishes that I have enjoyed as well. Would definitely recommend ppl to come and try
Drinks were amazing & the presentation of the dishes was super interesting. Pad Thai caused my soul to leave my body. 10/10

THEP is one of my favorite Thai places in the city!  Always super friendly staff and delicious food!  I always recommend this place to my friends and look forward to coming back!  The KRA-POW-PUFF is a great way to start of the meal and the pad Thai and curry is amazing!

Super delicious! Can't go wrong with the lunch special; definitely one of the best deals in the UES. For 12 bucks, got yummy calimari, soup, and a pretty hefty portion of fried rice (not a ton of shrimp in it... but it's 12 bucks!). Really fast too, so great when in a time crunch like I was.
Food is really good but we waited for 45 min . I will suggest to check your schedule first.
Great food! Would come again! Highly recommend! Ordered the fried rice and loved it. Thai iced tea was delicious and served in a cute glass!

The food was really delicious. We got the basil wok and the drunken noodles. Would recommend, could be spicier. Overall nice pleasant ambience and atmosphere. Our party had a great evening and they were able to accommodate 8 of us!
Great Thai spot ! Chicken pad Thai was perfect. You get $1 iced tea with check in. Great cocktail and appetizer selection. Recommend for intimate small/medium groups. Outside seating as well.

We came here for lunch, and I brought a lot of equipment. The waitress was very accommodating and she seated us in a spot where I could place the equipment. The food is also very good with a wide selection to choose from. I got the pad Thai with calamari and soup and it was really delicious. Will definitely come again.

We had a party of five here for lunch, and was seated promptly. Pond, our server, was attentive throughout the whole meal. Lunch special comprised of an appetizer, soup or salad, and an entree. Everything was delectable - I had the calamari (crispy with a sweet and tangy sauce), salad in sesame dressing, and the avocado massaman curry (basically avocado in curry, adds to the creaminess of the already creamy curry). Would recommend!

Everything was delicious and the prices were very reasonable! Our server, Pond, was really helpful and took excellent care of our group. Everything was clean and the decorations were pleasant to be around. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this place for a solid Thai meal.

I went with a big group. We ordered multiple appetizers, drinks and entrees. The appetizers were delicious - we ordered the chicken wings and Tom yum soup. My entree was SUPER spicy - i think it was the pad see ew, I asked for medium. I didn't realize how spicy it would be and I couldn't finish it. Portions are decently sized and overall the prices are pretty affordable for the amount of food served. Would go again, but order another entree

This is now my favorite Thai spot on UES. I am from Thailand and THEP has the most authentic Thai food you could get in Manhattan. Hands down! Their $10 lunch special in unbeatable too. If you're ever around, you need to stop by. You will thank me :)

Might be one of the best Thai restaurant around UES. Fried rice is sensational and other dishes are authentic. The only downside is the waiting time but that's quite understandable. For a busy restaurant, it takes time to be seated and food.
No comment
Great food, great location. We had the THEP platter and it was a great way to start our meal. Pretty silverware.
amazing food, fast service, and best value thai food i've had! their covid outdoor seating is perfect and working very well
No comment

One of the best Thai food around along with great service. Went for lunch with my Pet, service was awesome.. ordered basil and Thai fried rice, it was amazing. Great portion size and great value for money. Definitely recommend this place to any one.
THEP did an amazing job with their service and providing for me the warm soup for a night in and cozy atmosphere. 10/10 recommend

This place has really cute interior design. Good for lunch and dinner! They also have a lunch special as well, which comes w/ appetizer and soup or salad option. I love the fast but pleasant service from the servers. Def place to stop by!

Amazing food service and ambience. Food and place was both beautiful with an amazing price! Can't get over how worth it the lunch set was. $10 including starter, soup or salad, main and thai iced tea!!!! Love this place !
Spectacular ambiance and nicely done Thai dishes. Everything tasted great and it's a great weekend lunch spot overall.
Obsessed with their pad see ew!! Can be made vegan! Second best in the country  my friend loved her vegetarian red curry. Cute atmosphere.
No comment
No comment
Great experience, Pond was excellent and served us really well. Great lunch specials with large menu selection! Excellent service!

I really wasn't a Thai food person but Thep really converted me! Ordered the crab Rangoon, chicken pad Thai and udon noodles with shrimp and veggies and all were delicious, portions were generous and reasonably priced. This is definitely my new go-to! If you're ordering online do it from their website, 15% off your first order!

Our party of four came here for lunch on a Thursday, and they were able to seat us right away. The dining space and bathrooms were clean.The panang curry portions and pad Thai lunch portions are large here and tasted great.
One of my favorite Thai restaurant in NYC, The Red curry and spicy Udon is great! Would higly recommend this place! We live coming here at any occasion!
This is restaurant very good. I really enjoyed the food, ambiance, and atmosphere in the restaurant. Shout out to Perry for the kindness.
The khao soi lunch portion is the perfect size and blend of flavors. Such a unique dish for curry lovers and great presentation. This charming restaurant is a must for Thai.

The atmosphere and esthetics of the restaurant is great but the service and food all in all was mediocre. The udon drunken noodles was really good but their pad Thai was extremely sweet and very dry! One of the worst pad Thai I've ever tried.
My first time here but the food (I had Drunken Noodle with chicken) was excellent and service was great. Will definitely be back.
Excited to try this place! Tip for this busy spot, stay near by and try not to wander off that way you may get seated faster.
The food was amazing, would definitely recommend the Queen of Siam Basil! The service was also very good. We will be back.
The food was delicious. I got the panang curry with vegetables and a Thai ice tea. Highly recommend for good Thai food on the UES. The inside was also hip and beautiful.
Great outdoor dining location! Really cute set up and very COVID safe. The food was delicious and there's a wide variety of food on the menu. The drunken noodles was delicious.

New Thai restaurant in my neighborhood, have walked past it several times and decided to have lunch outdoors here today.  I had a lovely vegetarian basil dish with a glass of rose' and friendly conversation with Poy, my waitress.  The restaurant has a terrific menu, albeit a little bit pricy.  That said, I will come back for the wonderful food and ambience!

One of the worst experiences I've had with a restaurant! I reserved my spot for 5:30pm a day ahead on Yelp and I get a notification saying that my reservation got canceled after an hour or so. My frustrated self made another reservation for 6pm. Yet again I get a notification saying that my reservation got canceled. I took a 45min ride to Thep Thai for dinner just to know that I have to wait out in the cold for 2hours to be seated. I repeat 2hours!!! By far the worst wait time for a restaurant and there's no way to make reservations cus it'll get cancelled every time. Horrible!
No comment

Wonderful service, food, and ambiance! Great for lunch or an evening out! Loved the variety of dishes and chance to try so many for the lunch hour. Our waitress was attentive and considerate throughout the whole meal!

Amazing experience! It's my first time in NY and I'm glad I tried this place. Delicious food and great service too. Tom yum soup was soo flavorful and chicken dumplings were really tasty too. Reasonably priced for uptown ny. For drinks, I recommend the bourbon with cherries. It's like a Thai "old fashion". Love it!!
Wonderful food and atmosphere. I had a hankering for some curry, but I didn't expect the food to look so wonderful. Super affordable too!
Amazing decor, service, and food. Honestly the Pad See Eiw was the best I've ever had. Can't wait to be back!
No comment
Love this place, nice and cozy with outdoor seating. Workers are very nice, Definitely will be coming back.
Great food. I got one of the curries. It was great. I got mock duck. Sake was good but it was sweet- I did like the food.  Will come back.
No comment
Food was delicious, outdoor seating incredibly comfortable, staff so accommodating, kind and attentive. Special shout out to our server Nam!

This place was amazing!!! Perry was an amazing waitress. I had an amazing experience. She made my birthday special. Everyone was so kind. The food was amazing and we had amazing service. I definitely recommend.
The food is delicious the drink with frozen popsicle in the summer is also cute for Instagram
Food was great! The outdoor seating is so pretty and very private! I would definitely eat here again and again.
No comment

Super crowded, loud, and very overrated. I wanted to check this place out because it was highly rated and around the area I was only; however, the food was super salty, pricey, and nothing unique. The only reason why it's two stars because of one is the decorations and decent ambience. There's better Thai food in queens. It will be worth the trip.
No comment

I stopped in here for some pretty good Red Curry. Wonderful flavors, got it with chicken. I was solo so I didn't try anything else but the server recommended over one of their specialty dishes. I'd recommend trying this place out. Seemed hip and happening with good looking dishes coming out.

Great Thai spot! Although the wait was an hour and some change, it was definitely worth it. For starters you'll definitely want to order the chicken and shrimp dumplings. Then finish it off with the pork belly entree, trust me ... it was fireeeeeee! Definitely would recommend.

Definitely one of the more original Thai restaurants that adds in a lot of creativity with making each dish. Definitely order their summer cocktails, pineapple fried ice (comes in an actual pineapple), and spicy udon noodles. Can't go wrong with anything you choose and we cannot wait to come back!
No comment
This place is so cute and pretty. I've come here for my birthday before, the ambiance and food is amazing. You should come if you're in the area!

Very good food.  The fried rice dishes are served in a pineapple half and garnished. The drunken noodles had a slightly heavier sauce than what I'm use to, however very good.  The staff is very polite and despite the restaurant being very busy, they were timely with the service. It is a little noisy largely due to the concrete walls and floor.  Nicely decorated.
Great pad Thai. But very busy atmosphere. The appetizer platter is pretty nice. However, wait staff was not very friendly. Free Thai iced tea if you write a review.
This Thai restaurant is absolutely delicious! They are great for a simple evening out or as an order in when you want to not leave your home on a stormy evening. The quality never changes. Yum!
No comment
No comment

Had a pleasant lunch experience at THEP!  The restaurant is at a great location !  The vibes at the restaurant are very chill, calm.  The lunch special is to die for! I came here with my colleagues on our lunch break.  The staff and the service is fast!  I ordered the spring rolls, clear vegetable soup, and pad see ew chicken!  I also ordered the Thai Iced Tea as well ! Definitely worth your time and bucks !!
Food was amazing, especially the crab rangoon! Our waiter was Boong S, excellent service. Will be coming back here again

Such a nice spot- the tables are covered and have amazing heaters for each table that are so welcomed in this cold. The service was super efficient and the food came out quickly and was super hot and tasty. Thai iced tea was also great!

really enjoyed my meal here, got the tom kha soup and the tofu green curry.. it was totally spicy but not unbearable and the tom kha soup was amazing!!! The service was really good and the atmosphere was wonderful- lots of plants and really cool dishware. I would totally come back next time im in the area craving thai

Food was really great, had a really cool and hip atmosphere at a low cost. Highly recommend coming here. I ordered the pineapple fried rice and it was delicious. My sister ordered the pad tai and it was also really good! Loved it.

This place is super cute and has amazing food. I am visiting New York and saw this place on yelp  and decided to give it a try. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a cute Thai restaurant with really good food:)

Their outdoor seating is amazing! Warm and private rooms for dates! I loved their red curry! not a lot of restaurants has this much effort to make customers feel like indoors and they do. Definitely a top Thai place in nyc!

This is definitely the perfect spot for outdoor dining during covid. They have built individual little rooms for every table so it is super safe and warm! Highly recommend the curries, super creamy and delicious
I have eaten at many Thai restaurants and I have to say this one is my favorite. The food always tastes fresh and the service is excellent. I would recommend the pad Thai.
food was tasty! only thing is that when sitting inside they have you sit next to your party rather than across which can be awkward

I just moved to the Upper East Side and this place has been a goto for when I'm craving Thai food or have visitors to NYC that I want to impress. I've had an amazing culinary and restaurant experience every time. Pond, our waitress today was absolutely marvelous. Lunch special is generous and delicious! The silverware and utensils are so pretty. I always start with the Thai Iced Tea, then have gone on to order the Phad Kee Mao or the amazing green curry (mild spicy, it was still spicy but at perfect level!). The flavors are authentic, the vegetables plentiful, and meat fresh. May I say the best Phad Kee Mao in NYC honestly. I will keep coming back, especially seeing as the restaurant has a partnership with the app Seated. Absolutely recommend and guarantee you'll have a phenome experience.
Love the koi sa, our server Pond was so sweet and was so welcoming to my friend and my puppy I brought!
Good food and service, but we had a long wait. I would recommend the khao soi dish. Excellent broth and great noodles. I will come to this restaurant again.
Amazing place! So friendly and positive energy! I hope to come back here very soon! Loved the variety of the menu!
This is a very nice place to eat. I love the outdoor setting and the staff is amazing! Will eat here again soon.

B A D. Ordered delivery May 2020. Pork bun pork belly = dry and rubbery and grossly sweet. Duck salad = dried out, no flavor, and no care put in to making it--"slop it together" style. Drunken noodles = no flavor, otherwise typical thai food. Chicken curry puff = ok, but not redeeming for all the B A D. B A D B A D B A D!

Happened to be walking down the street towards a different restaurant when we caught an amazing smell wafting up the street. We were totally delighted by the outdoor heated booths and the delicious looking food coming out that we changed our plans and had dinner at THEP instead. The service was great, the outdoor seating felt safe and comfortable, and the food was GREAT! We had the shrimp dumplings, tom yum soup, pad see ew, and green curry and it was all delicious! Highly recommend if you need to break the cycle of home cooking and take out.

Came here for a Sunday brunch and was seated outside promptly with a dog. The wait staff was very kind and accommodating and the food was great for the price point. Don't forget to check in for $1 Thai iced tea! We got the starter platter and it was quite delicious. I also got the spicy stir fry udon noodles and it was pretty good for the price point.
Amazing Thai food. Had green curry and pineapple fried rice. Very delicious!! Wonderful decor. Excellent staff.
Love the lunch special! It's a lot of food for the price and the pork chops are great. Good neighborhood spot if you are in UES.
I had the fried rice and it was delicious! Thai iced tea was refreshing and not too sweet! My waitress Pond was really nice too

sooooooo good guys you have to try their  avocado curry！the best curry i ever had！and the Thai iced tea is good too. It's not too sweet so if you are tired with too much sugar in other iced tea you should try theirs.

The kra-pow puff is very life changing. The food is amazing and it has a lot of interesting flavors. This place has great service and great vibes inside this restaurant. Its my first time and it wont be the last time.

One of the best Thai places I've been to! The avocado massmum curry was excellent and rich, and the khao soi was very filling and authentic! Service was great- we opted to sit outside and got seated immediately and the food came out really quickly!
This is our first Thai food in the city and this place is amazing so far , atmosphere and service are good , Recommended
Great Thai food! The drunken noodles are fantastic- I ordered them gluten free and they were delicious. Service was good and the food was served steaming hot. Definitely recommend this place!

Well decorated Thai restaurant in UES. Perfect for dates with friends. I ordered the buns and coconut curry noodles which were both delicious. The food itself is not the BEST Thai food in Manhattan, not even close. But the leafy decor and lux ambience make THEP a trendy option for those looking to explore for dinner in UES.
Great service and food! Happy hour is a must. Pad kee mao and lemon drop drink highly recommend
Thai iced tea is one of my favorite drinks! Looks like juice but actually it's Milk tea, different from Bubble tea! Curry puff is crispy outside and soft inside!
Great food and environment! The massaman curry is the best as well as the pad Thai. I also really like the utensils! And Pond was an awesome waitress!

Came for lunch with friends on a weekday and was immediately greeted and seated! The restaurant has a really gorgeous decor and the menu is pretty extensive. Most importantly, there is a great lunch special menu--I got the Fried Calamari, Green Salad with Ginger Dressing, and the Chicken Pad Thai... for only $12! There's also a great check-in special to get a Thai Iced Tea for $1... so an entire multi-course meal for a STEAL! All of them were delicious. Particularly enjoyed the sweet and spicy sauce on the fried calamari, and the sweet dressing on the house salad. I also got an order of the Tom Yum soup which was good but a little bit sweet for my taste. Our server was Pond, who was fantastic and attentive during our entire visit. Would highly recommend this place! (Didn't get a chance to take a picture of the Pad Thai unfortunately because it looked so good and I went straight to eating it!)

The prescribed half-capacity mandate was not respected and another couple was sit right next to us, not to mention the lady in the party was so rude to sneeze without even putting her hand in front of her nose which was disgusting and very upsetting. We arrived at 9:40pm and were told the kitchen would close at 10:15pm, we were really rushed with all the plates being delivered one on top of the other but were understanding, however when at 10:30pm they turned on all the lights to make us understand we were not welcome and at 10:45pm they started cleaning the pavement with water and soap and putting all the chairs of the other tables on top of them we were shocked. Funny how the prescribed half-capacity mandate was not respected but they were so zealous to close the restaurant without worrying of being rude. We still left a nice tip but you deserved $0. Will not be coming back.
This is the bomb! Brilliantly spiced food,  old beer and inventive drinks. When the menu says "spicy" it does not kid you - love it - enjoy!
Super nice environment! Great spot to chill or have lunch with friends for some authentic Thai food!! The Khao Soi was exceptional! Would definitely come back again!
The food and decor was really good! Packed house on a Wednesday night. Definitely recommend!
Shared the Khao soi and green curry with my wife. Khao soi was on point! I'm generally careful with spice levels, but medium wasn't all that spicy here so I'd venture higher if I was to order again.

They have a great heated outdoor seating set up and the food and drinks were great, my only complaint is you can't make a reservation ahead of time to be seated, you must go there to put your name down and the website to watch how long it takes is not accurate.
Great service!!!!!High quality  food,very tasty. Restaurant has very beautiful decorations!!!
Had Sunday brunch here. Really good food for a decent price. I ordered the pad see ew and my party shared the thep platter appetizer. The food was delicious!!!

If you ever listened to Young Thug's falsetto on "On Fire" from his album Beautiful Thugger Girls, then you know what I'm about to say about this Shrimp Pad Thai I had from THEP... never have I ever indulged in such a savory Pad Thai dish. My mouth waters just thinking about the next time I can come here... hard/10

I went to this place during the summer time with my friend to have a couple of drinks and catch up and we ended up getting something to eat, the food and drinks are to die for, in the summer they have the patio open for people like me who enjoy getting some vitamin D :)

Came here with a group of 5 people. We got the platter, the Khao Soi, and Pineapple fried rice, all which were amazing. The platter is good to share between two people as it comes with five different varieties of appetizers, two pieces each. My favorite from that was the golden satchel. Amazing! My favorite dish was definitely the Khao Soi; the flavor of the curry was delicious. Service was also very good. We didn't wait that long for food. I will definitely be coming back!

Came with a group of four friends for brunch on Sunday! The ambiance is super cute and there isn't a wait, so it's a good place to get a last minute reservation or even walk in. It's super family friendly and they're great for delivery as well! I ordered the khao soi, which is a great choice for a chilly and rainy day. It was so delicious and authentic. I can not wait to come back to try more things. This is def one of my new favorite Thai restaurants in the city!! Check in on yelp for a free Thai iced!

I want to go back tomorrow!!!  We had the Pad Thai, Spicy Udon, Pineapple Fried Rice, and watermelon cocktail.  It was all great!  I wasn't a big fan of sitting at the communal table with my small kids.  I would have made a request not to sit there had I known.  Being so close to my neighbors I got to see some of the curry dishes and they looked delicious.  The decor was nice and service was good.  You can join the waitlist through Yelp which is super convenient.

The BEST Thai Restaurant I have been to in Manhattan!!! The atmosphere was very casual and inviting!! The service was VERY efficient!!... The flavor of the food was SPOT ON!!! I had the Green Curry and I must say it made me feel like I was transported to Thailand... The flavor profile was impeccable with a hint  of spice !!! ... I absolutely LOVED IT!!...I cannot wait to go back here and try out more dishes from menu!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!
Nice and calming place, great for first dates and small groups! The thai iced tea is to die for. Pad thai is a must and overall a very pleasant experience.
This place is very calm and has a soothing atmosphere. In addition the above head decorations are aesthetically pleasing. The food looks really good and I can't wait to have some.
Food was insanely good and Pod was an amazing server!!! The food in the pineapple was wildly delicious. The of Thai was insane

We did take out and the food is awesome!! I got the vegetable spicy udon noodles and the spice level and the preparation of the dish was delicious!  We got the spring rolls and they were good too. For the first time in a long while I found the sauce that came with the rolls not too sweet!  My husband got the drunken noodles and he found it on the spicy side, but good tasting!   Highly recommend!
The spot has really good food, and the drinks are nice. Service is impeccable. The restaurant is very nice.
Had the pad kee mao, and thai iced tea and crab rangoons. Food tasted great and service was perfect. Outdoor dining had a good ambiance as well
The food is delicious and the service is great! The tom kha is must have. Great spot for dates and good outdoor seating.
Paery was great! I loved the food. I had the drunken noodle and it was the best one I had ever. Interior is modern and clean. A definite 5/5.

This place is definitely one of my favorites on the Upper East Side area. Food is amazing, with great menu choices and friendly staff. Lunch special are a must do during week days if you need a break from work. I keep coming with my wife at least twice per month and with relatives and friends, every time they're in town.
It's an affordable yet beautiful nicely decorated  restaurant! Food is really good taste.

Quite surprisingly good food. Some dishes i historically did not like are real hits here. The pork belly is great, pad see ew, and the curries are amazing. Duck meat is real duck meat not the tough, tired looking meat you see in chinese restaurants sometimes. The silverware is like art, brings a nice touch to eating in at the restaurant. Gets busy at brunchtime, and seamless is expensive so order direct from their website and get a discount

SOme of the best Thai food in New York City can be found at THEP Thai.  I have been here on numerous occasions and have been pleased with the atmosphere, the service and the food every time.  There's a communal table and outside seating for warmer months.  Curries are always delicious and the noodle dishes I have had are always wonderful  Service is always friendly.
Excellent service; delicious food. Randomly stumbled upon this gem and it was worth the experience. Sit outside and try out the house Thai Tea

YUM! Everything was lovely from the seating (nicely done, especially along the side street) and the management (skilled at handling the wait list vs the walk-ins and even those who tried to circumvent the line and just slip into seats). House special pad thai was interesting (wrapped in an egg white crepe, topped w/2 large grilled shrimp) and the craft cocktails were heavenly. A perfect evening! We will be back soon!

The best review I can give is that we sat next to someone from Bangkok and she told us this is the best and she eats here all the time.  The service is friendly.  Prem was excellent in letting us know which dishes are spicy.  We had the lunch special green curry with chicken.  We also had the Tom Yum soup and the tea leaf salad.  Everything was delish.  Will definitely be back.
Great customer service! Loved the calamari, highly recommend pad Thai! Amazing Thai wings for starter. Currently has outdoor dining!
The food here was delicious. I ordered the tilapia fillet wrapped in banana leaves and it was very flavorful. Pond was very gentle and courteous. We will come back here again.
Sooo delicious and worth the wait! Perry was such an amazing waitress we had great service and the little shed was perfect for socially distance warm dinning!!! Definitely worth the wait once again!
This place was awesome! Great service and very flavorful authentic food. The portion sizes were satisfactory as well. I recommend this place to all Thai food lovers.

One of the most legit Thai places I've had in the city for a while. The service is great - very attentive servers who were friendly and polite. Food was delicious and felt authentic. Overall a very enjoyable experience. Would love to come back if I'm ever in the area and in the mood for Thai food!
Really cute ambiance and sat a walk-in for 3 really quickly. Friendly staff and an allergy friendly menu. Excited to find another go-to place in the neighborhood!
Really liked the green curry! Been looking for good green curry in NYC and this was really good! Must visit!

My fiancé and I stumbled on this stylish Thai restaurant while exploring the UES and I'm glad we did! Everything from the aesthetic to the service and to the food quality / presentation was top notch! The outdoor seating was definitely a huge plus. We ordered the chicken pad Thai and the Cashew King with chicken. Both were excellent choices! I have to highlight that the cashew dish is probably the best I've had in the city... and i order it everywhere. If you're thinking about it - go for it! Highly recommend. :)
No comment

Absolutely horrible service the waitress was super unfriendly. This is absolutely unacceptable in the hospitality industry - the ambience is good so I will give them a rating of three for ambience and hospitality maybe zero and average rating of 1.5 makes it a one star
It is the first time we go to NY. We saw THEP on the Yelp than we decided to try it.The red curry is delicious. And I really love the Thai tea.
Good food. Very flavorful. Has a few interesting combinations you can't get everywhere. If you're in the area worth stopping by for dinner.

The food was so good and the restaurant is really cozy. My friend and I ordered the panang curry with crispy duck and the shrimp pad kee mao. Both dishes was flavorful and not too spicy as I asked for. Definitely will be coming back.
We typically love this place but ordered pick up a couple of days ago and our food had no flavor to it. We were disappointed, as we ventured out of quarantined to get it and wasn't worth it.
Super clean spot with spacious inside.  Tom Kha was wicked good with butterflied, fresh shrimps.   Split a fried rice with soup and edamame - nice portions!!

I've eaten at many different thai places (normally in Southern California), and this restaurant would definitely be in my top 3 favorites. We arrived around 6PM and it was fairly crowded. It was busy, loud, but thankfully warm and inviting as opposed to walking around looking for other restaurants in 20 degree weather! We ordered chicken pad thai, spicy noodles, panang curry, and fried rice. All of the dishes were perfectly flavored and delicious! The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because the food was on the slimier side and I am super picky about texture. Other than that, this is a must have if you're ever in Upper East Side Manhattan!
Delicious!!!! Food was perfect. Service was perfect. Best thai food I've ever eaten. Already planning our next visit :)

Absolutely wonderful restaurant. Presentation presentation presentation. My fried rice came in a pineapple! The drinks are so beautifully made - mine had flowers in it! The interior is well decorated with lots of plants, outside is lovely for sitting on a nice day. Great food and friendly, attentive staff. I'm also gluten free and essentially half the menu can be either naturally gluten free or modified slightly to accommodate. Will be a regular here!

Their food is flavorful and they actually make it spicy if requested! I also love that they can make many dishes vegan if you request, and they taste just the same as if it wasn't. I'll definitely be back!
We had duck tamarind, chicken satay, and pork buns. Highly recommend the pork buns. Excellent service.
This is my favorite Thai restaurant for lunch and dinner!  Delicious menu options and wallet friendly!
Good service and I like the taste of the food. The ambience is nice and clean. Will come back for more next time!
Very good food and friendly staff.  The soft crab fried rice was amazing and the crab tasted very fresh.  The plants also make this place really cute.  Would recommend!

This restaurant is so beautiful! I'm so in love with the decor. The food here is also very delicious. Try their Golden Sachet. It's to die for. I want to go back there now just thinking about it. I went on a Tuesday so the wait wasn't bad. Great service too. Everybody working there seemed very happy. Highly recommend!
Came here for a lunch special, amazing service amazing meal! It's not crowded. A good place to hang out w friends. One of the best Thai food in NYC.

THEP Thai Restaurant is a great Thai dining experience. The food tastes just as good as Up Thai but with a shorter wait (15 minutes vs. 45 minutes). The service was amazingly quick (food came within 5 minutes after ordering). The pad see ew was great but my favorite was the pineapple fried rice. It was so tasty and the rice came in a carved out pineapple.
The place has such a nice vibe and the food is so good! One of the best Thai restaurants I have been to.
Thai ice tea is very tasty! Lunch special price is decent. Also the cashew king is amazing. Vibe is good as well.
We love this place, best curry and spring rolls in the city , salad is really good - great portion and filling really recommend !
ThepThai is absolutely the best Thai Restaurant in NYC!!! The Food is Delicious!! Great service
GREAT food, amazing service. Clean and super friendly. Very affordable prices. Suitable for a quick lunch bite or a sit down evening dinner
Delicious Thai restaurant on the upper east side with a great outdoor dining section. It was great for COVID times! Waiters were accommodating and friendly.

Everything was very good!  We lived in Bangkok for 3 months, and the papaya salad was very fresh and authentic. The Tom Kha Gai soup had just the right spicy kick to it. It came in a hot metal bowl that kept the soup nice and hot. The Pad Kee Mao with crispy duck was delicious! The spring dumplings and Thai ice tea were really good too. The food was plentiful and reasonably priced!

We were looking for a restaurant to eat and fell in love with the sight of THEP. It looked very inviting from the outside and was so amazing on the inside! The food was fantastic espically the WOK dishes. They did not disappoint!
Our "Go To" Thai restaurant on the UES.  Creative menu and great value.  Pad Thai and Avacado  Massaman Curry are my favorites.
We looked up Thai restaurants and this one just popped up. We decided to come and it was a good decision. The food is amazing and the price is affordable. We would 10/10 recommend.
Good vibe. Nice fusion Thai food ! Spicy shrimp Udon was still really fattening and greasy after telling them to add less oil when they cook, yet all in all it was decently tasty :)

Wonderful. Had no reservation, and wasn't given a hard time about it. After being seated, we received food within minutes. The drunken basil noodles were incredibly fresh. Would definitely go back again. Cute date spot.
Great Thai restaurant. Service and food is terrific. Their spicy is really spicy though but I enjoyed it. Will come back again.
Great ambience, friendly service, delicious food at good prices for the lunch special.
Súper tasty! One of the best Thai places! The panang curry is delicious! Portions are also great!
Food was amazing! Ordered the drunken noodle lunch special and a thai iced tea. Easily the best thai food in the city. Out server Pond was also really great!

Pad se ew was delicious. A lot of places typically use too many veggies and not enough noodles, or it can be too oily, and I had no issues whatsoever. Thai iced tea was also exactly what I was expecting.

Beautiful interior design and great ambience. Came here at 5pm when the restaurant opened for the evening and it got busy pretty quickly. Excellent service; staff knows to check up on how everything is going for customers but not too frequently that it's annoying. Food was also excellent! Much better than the many thai restaurants I've been to in midtown Manhattan.

It's a Wednesday afternoon and busy here, everything me and my friend ordered all came out delicious. Love the hanging plants decor here too. Would definitely recommend this place, either small or large group.

Worth the walk from Central Park! Such a cute and intimate restaurant. The lunch special is a great deal - soup or salad, starter and an entree with chicken for about $12. I enjoyed the drunken noodles with just the right amount of spice and my husband devoured the pad Thai. All topped off with a refreshing glass of Thai iced tea. Definitely recommend!
Food was pretty good. Thai tea was not very sweet. The wait was very long and hostess could have been friendlier
I ordered the green curry with rice, the food was pretty good but the rice was too sticky.
Ordered the avocado massa and pad see ew with the pom bomb drink (the one with the popsicle in it). Pretty good, full of flavor! Not to mention, decor is on point. Will be coming back :)
The atmosphere here is really great, and the food is also awesome! My friend and I are both impressed by the food quality here and the value.

I'm not a very adventurous foodie, Im that guy that orders chicken wings when I don't know what the food is. I've never cared to try Thai food, but in UES the options are limited. Saw the wonderful reviews and it was amazing. Had the chicken Cashew King It was so good! Wish I could have it again! Please stop and support such a great establishment!
The meal was really delicious~~~especially the coconut rice~~~the seafood salad is also a good choice~~~
Great food and such cute decor! The pad see ew was delicious, and tasted even better with a Thai ice tea. Great service and atmosphere. Highly recommend !
No comment
Great food, great service, great cocktails! Got the popsicle drink, calamari and tea leaves salad.
Came here on a rainy day. Pong helped us out with everything. She's very good! The food was great and the interior was cute. Amazing place to eat on a rainy day.

What I love most about this place is how kind, genuinely kind.... and lovely the staff are. It adds a world of difference to the  experience of coming here. On top of that, the food is consistently good, tasty, excellent. Wholesome and delicious. THEP is one of my go-to places in the city for its impeccable service and consistently delicious food. I highly recommend it.

this place is so nice, it's pretty tight to fit in there. There's a big table for big parties which fit comfortably, the smaller tables are pretty tight to fit in but its a great way to make new friends with the party next door. There is sitting outside as well most of the tables are for two. There is a bar with full service and plenty of drink specials and great selection of liquors. It gets pretty packed, specially for dinner, recommend making a reservation if not,  the usual wait time is around 15 to 20 minutes. The staff is really nice, friendly and attentive, from the hostess to the waiting staff. The menu is pretty extensive and has a lot of options from vegetarian to all types of protein. The prices are reasonable and pretty large portions as well. Started with the Tom Kha soup and it was delicious, plenty of flavor, lots of lemongrass aroma and flavor and that coconut flavor  mmmm so good. The main course was Siamese Fried Rice with chicken and it was really good. The stir fried rice was perfectly cooked, the chicken was tender and seasoned to perfection, mixed in was vegetables and eggs. Everything was really good, the food was perfect, and i honestly love this place. Will come back soon to try more of the menu.
Pretty good food nothing exceptional but definitely a good spot in ues. We got the pad see ew and chicken sausage fried rice. Could be spicier
This spot serves presentable and savory Thai food. Great place to bring family and friends!
No comment

This is my favorite Thai place! I had the tofu pad thai with thai tea. They have a great lunch special--good options and a ton of food for the price. I always come here if I am in the area. Highly recommend!

Came here for the first time and I had a nice experience. The service was on point. Timing of the appetizer and the main dish was also good. I had we had shrimp pad, pineapple fried rice and green cury. All of them was very tasty. The rice for the cury was little overdone, and there were some rice clumps for the pineapple fried rice. Other than  that it was definitely a 5 star experience.
The red curry  is good. But if you don't like spicy don't get it. Their Thai iced tea tastes kind of watered down.

I did not expect the lunch special portions be filling, but was very surprised. The flavors here are authentic and amazing. This a great place with a great atmosphere with even better food. Will definitely come back here again.
No comment

column3: ダウンタウン, Detroit, MI
column6: Foods are fresh and service is good. The iced tea tastes more like milk tea but it was great. Would like to recommend to my friends and come again.
The decor of the restaurant is very pretty and cozy. They have a table that can hold a party of 10 + , which is a plus for those who have a big group.
No comment
VERY YUMMY FOOD!!!!!! Amazing service and definitely an experience you won't regret!!!! Our server made an amazing flower straw and it was very sweet!

Came here with a friend as we were strolling by. We originally wanted to try another place close by but they had a long wait. I ordered the garlic sauce chicken with white rice. It was just cold and very underwhelming and with no flavor. My friend got the tofu pad thai and it as well just did not have any flavor. The price was average for the place and we had to sit outside because there is limiting seating in the inside.
Great decor for outdoor seating. Had the drunken noodle and Thai Ice Tea and they were both great. Highly recommend for those on the upper east side.

Excellent and plentiful Thai food!! Great service! I had the cashew king and it was delicious and excellent filled with nuts and veggies .   Outside seating was acceptable, but it's what you can expect during COVID.

Dinner was great! We were a party of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids. They really are a kid friendly place. I'm picky about Thai food since I'm half Thai and this place did not disappoint. Food flavors and quality were amazing

Nice and cozy little place...(little) is an understatement. A little overpriced for the size of plate you get, but......the food is really tasty. Everything we ordered had a mouthful of different flavors.
Pretty good food, the fried rice is delicious and really nice atmosphere. Just wished the music wasn't so loud
The best green curry I've had in New York! It was simply really really good. Do visit!

Food and service was really good! We ordered an appetizer and main dishes. I ordered Pad See Ew with the Crispy Quarter Long Island Duck. It was delicious but the duck was a little dry. Other than than, would definitely recommend to check out!

Great place, good food.  Not as spicy as we would have liked even after adding more spice to it but still tasty.  Food came quickly and atmosphere was inviting with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  Not far from central park.  Would return.  Also Pond wss a great server, very attentive.

I had the Khao soi, It was very yummy. Lots of great flavors, and I recommend getting It with the bone in chicken. Has a little bit of spice, but not too much that It was over-powerful. Reminded me of the dish I had back in chiang mai! Would definitely come back

I'm a regular here for their lunch special and sometimes i come here for dinner. I always get the khao soi (curry sauce based rice noodles) for myself and lemongrass porkchop with rice for my toddler. She loves the porkchop. it's very tender and flavorful. I love the decorations and the food here, also their friendly staffs!
Great Thai Food option in the UES. Nice decoration, outdoor space and affordable option. Recommend.

I ordered from there yesterday and within a few minutes after consumption I felt stabbing pains in my stomach. A few minutes after this pain stopped, the food was violently eliminated from my body. Needless to say, I will not be eating here again. Mind you, I ordered vegetable pad Thai with spring rolls, items I though were pretty neutral,

Located on the UWS at the corner. If you go in the summer they have ample outdoor seating, inside is tight if you're brining a larger group, but great decor and ambiance. Started off the with the appetizer sampler, but would not recommend that. Try 1-3 apps individually, which I feel may come out better. Ordered the pad kee mao for the entree with mock duck and it had the right amount of sauce, flavor, and spice. Will definitely be coming back to try more items on the menu. Service was a bit slow, but staff was very friendly and accommodating.
No comment

Very nice staff. Quite lively and popular.. with a diverse client base. Nice indoor and outdoor seating. The menu doesn't appear so unique, but what we had was special, especially their take on a duck salad, with some light,  chlled noodles in it, tolerably spicy and lots of healthy veggies (not just lettuce) and plenty of non fatty duck. The wine selection was quite good. I am tempted to give it five stars but I reserve such for higher end restaurants.

Great food! Good lunch special (appetizer + soup / salad + entree) during the weekdays. They used to include Thai iced tea as part of the lunch special. I believe they no longer offer it, but it's still a good deal nonetheless. Pretty cool ambiance as well. Not too crowded during weekdays at daytime, but can get a bit more crowded on evenings and weekends. Also,  nice service by the waitress, Boong!

The decor is very cute and clean. Pretty modern. The lunch special is very affordable considering the location. I ordered the drunken noodles which was pretty good. The staffs are very attentive and nice. Overall, I would come back again.
No comment
Love this place! Best Thai restaurant on the upper east side. Get the Thai sausage fried rice, it is delicious!
Great decor and tasty food. Had a fun time. Good location on the UES. Thai tea and spicy udon were delicious
The food is good, our server is nice. HOWEVER, the girl at the reception is rude and dishonest. This is unacceptable!

We got the shrimp pineapple fried rice and beef pad see eiw, and both dishes were very good. They are very generous with the shrimps, and the beef was little overcooked as it was dry but the noodles were good! Thai iced tea was also not too sweet, but enough to keep my sweet cravings satiated. The servers and managers were also very nice. Our server was Aey, and she was professional and kind. Great atmosphere and interiors! I would come back again.

I loved this restaurant! Very laid back and chilled out, and the drinks were not watered down! It was more on the pricey side- I paid $14 for a mixed drink, but otherwise fantastic! The service was exceptional and the food was great.

I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. I gave it three stars because they accommodate gluten free options and even have spring rolls and pad kee mao that's gluten free but the veggies they use taste funny like old or sprayed with something. I'll come back for the spring rolls but no more veggies.
Great service , great food & no wait at lunchtime :) made a really cute flower out of the straw, nice extra detail

My absolute favorite Thai restaurant. The food is amazing and has great portions. The inside of the restaurant is super cute and the staff is so nice. The food also holds up very well for delivery. Definitely recommend if you're looking for Thai on the UES!

This restaurant is really beautiful and has great ambiance and design. The drinks are really delicious and they have an impressive range of cocktails - I really liked the Thai iced tea. They are really good at playing their food and their food was pretty tasty - they offer a wide variety of Thai fare. I would definitely recommend this place for people who want a nice night out - it provides a very nice romantic feeling.
pad thai was great! we had a party of 6 and was seated right away and the food came out so quickly!
No comment
No comment

Went with the green curry as it is my go to dish from any Thai Restaurant. The presentation was amazing and the curry was completely authentic. A good portion for the price and the spice level was exactly what I wanted. If I lived in the area I would come here once a week.

This place has been our favorite spot for Thai food up town so far and I don't think that is going to change anytime soon. Their tea leaf salad and goddess garlic are our go to! You must TRY! And today it's our first visit to the restaurant and we LOVE it!
